item.title: Dsal | 96 illegal employees in G-Dragon concert
item.description:
On Saturday, police and work services did an operation at the Korean singer G-Dragon merchandising stalls at the Galaxy Arena, where 96 possibly in illegal staff were found. Two officials of the organization were taken to the squadron for investigation
The past weekend was of great euphoria at Cotai, with three concerts by popular Korean singer G-Dragon in the Galaxy Arena. However, on Saturday morning a joint operation of the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) and the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL) detected 96 employees suspected of being in an illegal situation in the merchandising selling zone. Subsequently, the CPSP issued a statement confirmed during the process of verifying the identity of the workers the presence of 96 non-resident workers, whose authorization to work would have to be confirmed with DSAL. Following the discovery, two officials of the concert organization were taken to the police squad for investigation. The authorities did not add more information about the case, in addition to the admission of CPSP that would be investigating the situation and that were found infringements, the case will be treated according to the law. Until the closing of this edition, DSAL had not been pronounced on the occurrence, nor the company that organized the concerts, Tencent Music Entertainment Live. The situation generated controversy and many publications on social networks. One of the most discussed theories pointed to a possible revenge of clandestine ticket sellers, who would have been expelled from the enclosure on Friday, which will allegedly warned the authorities for the illegal situation of the employees. NETWORK TRAINS In addition to revenge theory, images of publications were also shared to recruit part -time workers during concerts, especially on Chinese social networks. In one of the publications, the organizer sought to recruit women under 30, referring as a daily remuneration 200 Renminbis, as well as an additional bonus in accordance with sales. The announcement also indicated that the employer was willing to offer accommodation to employees who needed it. Also at the level of the legitimate sale of tickets for the Korean star concert there was confusion. In Hong Kong, the cityline ticket sales platform has been complained due to the printing of the wrong date, number of wrong tickets and the passivity of employees in resolving and treatment of complaints.

item.title: Cultural Week | Government wants to change events to Zhongshan
item.description:
The executive intends that the 17th edition of the China Cultural Week and Portuguese-speaking countries will be fully held in Zhongshan, but the Lusophone associations involved in the event are against the change of the event's nevral center, despite supporting the expansion to the great bay.
The government intends that the 17th edition of the China Cultural Week and Portuguese -speaking countries will be fully held in Zhongshan, Canton province, despite being locally funded. Information about the Institute's plan for the promotion of commerce and investment of Macau (Ipim) was advanced by the platform newspaper in the Friday issue, but has the opposition of local associations. According to the publication, IPIM maintained separated meetings with the Lusophone Associations involved in the event and told them that at least this year, the event will leave Macau to move inside. After the meetings, the associations have joined to refuse that the event be taken entirely to Zhongshan, although they agree that the interior penetration is positive for all parts. According to the letter sent to the IPIM, Lusophone associations argue “the importance of preserving the event in the MSAR, maintaining it as the nerve center of this cultural celebration”. “Macao has been, throughout history, the bridge between Lusophone and Chinese cultures, and we believe this character must remain,” he was added. To the platform, the Macao Forum did not deny the intention to hold the entire event in Zhongshan, and assumed that it aims to “ensure the success of the event, both in Macau and the Great Bay, for all parties involved, as well as for participants and the public”. The Macao Forum also indicated that it is acting "in accordance with the decision taken by all parties participating in the Macao Forum, at the 20th Ordinary Meeting of the Permanent Secretariat, to include Elements of the Cultural Week in the Great Bay." Still, the body has pointed out that "it is collaborating with all its partners, whether government or civil society, including the associations of Portuguese -speaking countries in Macau, with a view to welcoming and integrating all the ideas, concerns and contributions it has received and continues to receive." "Wrapping paper" In addition to the trip to Zhongshan, the associations complain about the new role they are taking into the event, since the integration of the Macao Forum in IPIM, which made them lose functional autonomy. In addition to this aspect, the platform, the cultural week of China and Portuguese -speaking countries has been awarded to a company, which deals with all the details of the event, on the fringes of associations, who is responsible for the role of just indicating the names to be invited. This new reality led to a source of associations, which refused to be identified, to collapse to the newspaper that associations only feel as “package papers” to legitimize the event. Among the complaints against the new role is the fact that associations currently do not even have a maneuver room to receive or socialize with the artists or economic agents invited to the event of these countries. Given this reality, associations suggest the “limitation of the intervention of companies that do not know the cultural concept developed over the years” to ensure “loyalty to the original values ​​of the event”.

item.title: Communities | Emídio Sousa succeeds José Cesário as secretary
item.description:
The new secretary of the Portuguese communities has a governance experience in the environment and for more than 10 years has been mayor of Santa Maria da Feira. In turn, José Cesário will return to the functions of deputy
The Prime Minister of Portugal, Luís Montenegro, chose Emídio Sousa as the new Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities. The replacement of José Cesário, who had resumed these functions last year, and who fulfilled four distinct periods in office, was revealed with the announcement of the members who constitute the new Portuguese executive. The appointment means to Emídio Sousa a change of folder, since in the previous government had performed the functions of Secretary of State for the Environment. The new responsible for the Portuguese communities portfolio has a career essentially linked to policy and public administration. According to his profile on the LinkedIn social network, he has a degree in Public Administration, an area in which he also obtained a master's degree. For about 20 years he worked in the waters of Gaia, where he reached the position of secretary general, and then, in October 2013, assumed the functions of mayor of Santa Maria da Feira, in the district of Aveiro, where he was for about 10 years. Before being elected mayor, he had performed the duties of councilman. “With a quiet conscience” In turn, after becoming a public that was no longer secretary of state of communities, José Cesário left a farewell message on social networks. “It was a great honor for me to have returned to perform these governmental functions in the government led by my friend Luís Montenegro and served the Portuguese resident abroad. It was a very difficult year, full of obstacles, in which, despite everything, it was possible to perform some measures, which I hope to translate into more valuses for those who live outside Portugal,” wrote Cesário. "The choice for a new passport and the expiration of its expiration date, the resolution of the salary problem of our employees in Brazil, the normalization of the activity of the Portuguese Communities Council and the alteration of the association support regime and communication of communities are good examples of this action," he was added. The extension of the passport period from 5 years to 10 years is not yet in force. "Honestly, I leave with a quiet conscience, but with the certainty that there is a lot to do to have a closer and effective relationship with our communities," he said. "Of course, I wish my successor all luck to the world, being sure that, being a wise and hardworking man, everything will do to serve the Portuguese abroad," he said. In place of always Despite leaving the position of Secretary of State, José Cesário will assume the duties of deputy, after being elected by the circle outside Europe. This is a return to a parliament that Cesário has well known and for which he has been successively elected since 1983, with only an interregnum in 2022, first as representative of Aveiro and since 2005 as a representative of communities outside Europe. "From today return to the Assembly of the Republic, as deputy elected from Europe, ceasing my duties of Secretary of State of Portuguese Communities," he wrote. “Now it's time to dedicate myself to parliamentary life, representing with determination, work and humility those who have elected me, whom I owe so much and with whom I have learned so much. Let's go to work!…” Rita Santos regrets “friend” The chairman of the Macao Public Function Association (ATFPM) lamented that the “friend” José Cesário is no longer the Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities. “It was a surprise […] Dr. José Cesário, besides being a secretary of state, is our friend,” he acknowledged in statements to the Macau channel of TDM. "It is more for the human issue, for their ability to communicate with people, to solve the problems, so we have had a good relationship with him. Whether he is in government, or not, he is always willing to help people. We were sad, but we have to look forward," he added. Rita Santos also pointed out that José Cesário will continue to defend the community, now in Parliament. "He is a deputy and I think that with the position of deputy he can continue to fight for the legitimate rights of the Portuguese to live outside Portugal," he said. At the same time, he left wishes to establish a good relationship with the new Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities, Emídio Sousa. "With the new secretary of state we hope that there may be collaboration and good contact, as with Dr. José Cesário, and we wish them the biggest success, to solve the problems of the Portuguese who are quite enough," he said.

item.title: Elections | Candidate lists fall to less than half
item.description:
The Electoral Commission received at the end of the deadline for nine requests for direct suffrage to the Macao Parliament, less than half than in the previous elections in 2021. The next step will be the presentation of the lists of candidates and political programs by June 26
The Legislative Assembly Electoral Affairs Commission (Caeal) received nine applications from candidate lists to the next legislative elections, less than half of the lists that tried to participate in the 2021 electoral act. There were 19 lists of candidates for the Legislative Assembly (AL), although five lists and 21 candidates -15 of which pro -democracy -were then excluded by “not defending the basic law” being “faithful to the sons”. In a statement issued on Friday, the Electoral Commission stressed that, after finishing the deadline for requesting requests, the candidacy committees that were recognized may submit the list of candidates and political program by June 26. The list will only be “definitely admitted” to the “after passing” elections of the candidates, stressed the electoral body. The State Security Defense Commission will determine "whether candidates defend the basic law and are faithful" to the MSar and issue a binding opinion, of which "there is no complaint or litigation." This State Security Defense Committee will announce, by late, until July 15, the decision on the list of candidates for the legislatures, scheduled for September 14. The Electoral Commission promised to “rigorously” the new electoral law, approved after the 2021 exclusions, “which aims at greater implementation of the Macao principle governed by Patriots”. In good Portuguese On Tuesday, by submitting his application for candidacy, Portuguese deputy José Pereira Coutinho said he was confident that he will not be disqualified, despite being-along with Deputy Ron Lam-one of the few critical voices of the government in AL. "The fact that being critical does not mean that I am not a patriot, I am also patriot," said the former candidate for the Assembly of the Portuguese Republic, in 2015, by the Party We Citizens. “We have always worked here for Macao's good and for the good of the citizens of Macau,” added Pereira Coutinho. Thirty -three deputies are part of AL, 14 of which are elected by direct suffrage, 12 for indirect suffrage through associations, and seven are later appointed by the head of the local government. In the case of the indirect suffrage, the Electoral Commission said it had received six application, more than in 2021, for the five sectors: industrial, commercial and financial; workers; Liberal professionals; social and educational services; and cultural and sports. Four years ago, the 19 initial lists of candidates for direct suffrage had three Lusodescendants. Two of them, José Pereira Coutinho and Lídia Lourenço, were on the Nova Esperança list, linked to the Macao Public Function Workers Association. The third, architect Rui Leão, secretary general of the International Union of Architects, was part of the Civic Observatory list, headed by the then deputy Agnes Lam. Pereira Coutinho did not disclose the composition of the list, but guaranteed the presence of Rita Santos, who requested in October the suspension of the office of the Portuguese communities to prepare the elections. Pereira Coutinho resigned in 2021 to the mandate of a counselor of the Portuguese communities, for which he had been elected in 2015 by the Circle of China, Macao and Hong Kong.

item.title: Pecunaries Checks | Former Beneficiaries defend better assignment criteria
item.description:
Given the changes to the pecuniary reimbursement plan, HM has heard three permanent residents who will no longer receive the check because they do not reside permanently in Macao, including a macanese born in the territory. Arnaldo Gonçalves, academic and former Beneficiary, defends a better distribution of support depending on the income of families
The rules for the attribution of pecuniary checks will change and now it is really necessary to be 183 days a year in the territory. The exceptions are some and arrest with students from Macau who are attending courses abroad or residents to work remotely to Macau and who are enrolled in the Social Security Fund, among other situations. However, many people will be left out, even though they have lived for several decades in the territory or even macanese born in Macau, that is, many of the members of the Macanese diaspora. In the case of Arnaldo Gonçalves, a permanent resident resident in Lisbon, he lived several decades in Macau, having worked for the government and was a university professor in the area of ​​political science. Six years ago, he returned to Portugal, being renovated, and told HM that he was already waiting for the day he was going to stop receiving the ten thousand dates annually. "This measure aims to give people a counterpart, given the difficulties existing in consumption and the characteristics of life. I don't live in Macau, and I think from the point of view of equity, the government has never been able to make a fairer regime from the distributive point of view, because there is no system of attribution from the income, and deep down there are multimillionaires that gain the subseck, like the pensioners, all," he said. This is what Arnaldo Gonçalves says "lament". "It is hard work to make an assessment of people's economic possessions, and so everyone receives the same as it is more practical in administrative terms," ​​he said. Maria João Ferreira, macaense of gem, daughter of the famous poet Adé, will also fail to receive the pecuniary check. He says he understands, but also criticizes the executive's positions. "I was already waiting and accepted with all the tranquility. It is fair, since I do not live there and I have the chance to be 183 days. I thank the time of checks that was dismissed. I lived in Macau until I was 16, but I was born there and still have family. Even the pandemic was there every year of vacation. mentioned. Maria João Ferreira, currently in the direction of Macao's house in Lisbon, says she was “shocked” with a very concrete case. "A few years ago, when he was doing his doctorate, he learned of a civil servant who did two service committees in Macao and was a contemplated BIR money and even told me, not just me, that I thought it was funny as he was there so recently, he was entitled to such a benefit," he said. "This is what I think is bad. It is one thing to go to do a service committee in public administration, or two or three, but it was never, in fact, resident. It is, as it were, an immigrant, because it will only work. This is how I see things," he added. Patacas Amealdas For Arnaldo Gonçalves, the ten thousand annual patacas served as a “Management Fund” for trips to the territory, where he still has family and where he travels frequently. "I've never used this money for personal purposes, you know? But I think these changes are a good measure, justifiable, and I even think it's selfish, that I've been entitled to this support for so many years. There are other people who need it," he said. In the case of Maria João Ferreira, the cash of the pecuniary check was also used for expenses in Macao and with trips to the territory. "I have an account in Macao, and when I went there, if I needed to buy the plane ticket, my sister said the money here, or this money served to fund my stay in Macao," he explained. Sofia Mota, a permanent resident and former Maradora in Macao, regrets the absence of explanations for these changes. "It depends on what the pecuniary check is for, whether it is a way of distributing the wealth or profits of casinos to the people who are part of the territory, or have already done; either if it is a condition to be part of the territory. I do not realize the premise in which the pecuniary check measure is based, and depending on the premise these changes may be more or less acceptable." The teacher considers that "it makes no sense that those who contribute to social security at their own initiative, as is my case, are not covered." "It seems that there is a first and second and second social security system. People who come to Portugal to provide family care seem not to be covered and yet are out of the territory for reasons of force majeure. What is meant by providing subsistence to family members, is not realizing the function of the check and the coherence of exceptions," he said. Sofia Mota confesses that she also used money to "a management fund to go to Macau, or to invest in formation." The first reactions The changes to the pecuniary reimbursement program were presented at the end of May and report that three groups will be exempt from the obligation to be 183 days a year in Macao and thus receive the check. They are the residents under 22 in 2024 and where one parent meets the requirements for receiving the check; the beneficiaries of the disability pension and the beneficiaries of disability allowance. There are eight other situations where residents may have access to the check. This is what happens when residents attend higher education outside the territory; When they are hospitalized in a hospital outside the sons, those who are over 65 and live in the interior of China or, even under 65, have health reasons that justify the permanence inside China. Residents who work outside Macao are also covered by the exceptions to an employer registered at the MSAR Social Security Fund and residents outside the MSAR who are responsible for the family aggregate subsistence. These are also attached to the exercise of official functions outside Macao; the registration of domicile, work or study in the deepened cooperation zone; And yet the work done in the cities of large bay except Hong Kong that is left out. Deputy Pereira Coutinho manifested against the changes to the pecuniary check referring to violate the Macao Basic Law, namely in article 25, which guarantees the equality of the residents of Macao before the law and prohibits discrimination. The article determines that "the residents of Macao are equal before the law, without discrimination due to nationality, ancestry, race, gender, language, religion, political or ideological convictions, economic instruction and situation or social condition." More recently, the Macao Synergy Association publicly stated that changes to the pecuniary reimbursement plan in economic development are not in accordance with the wishes of the population. Ron Lam also criticized the executive for applying the changes “in a hurry” which only came to cause more controversy: “the government was in a hurry and applied a sudden measure, without making any public consultation, with only behind -the -scenes movements leading to the population to question governance,” he said. "Consultations with local associations were simulated, which only generated more criticism and caused more unnecessary controversy," he added.

item.title: Camões was Mozambique's “great‘ amateur ”, influencing his poetry
item.description: The academic Lourenço do Rosario highlighted on Friday that Luís de Camões influenced Mozambican poets as a "great" amateur ", asking for more research to discover a camões hosted on the island of Mozambique, in the north of the country. "Camões was a great amateur, was very fond of women and one of the reasons that he was always in prison was exactly because he had several problems with women, especially married (…). He arrives in 1567, had no money to continue the trip to Portugal, had no money to live on the island of Mozambique," said the academic Mozambican Lourenço do Rosário, after the opening of the second congress. 500 years of Camões. Mozambique welcomes the second 500th anniversary Congress of the birth of Luís de Camões, emphasizing the relationship of the Portuguese poet with the Indian Ocean and the Mozambican territory. Lourenço do Rosário, essayist and professor of literature, said Camões was welcomed “in Macúti”, houses built with local material, “by Mutian women” (woman, in the local language of Nampula), when he arrived at Mozambique Island. "He makes that poem‛ Endchas to Barbara Slave, "which is one of the most beautiful poems he wrote about women, so Camões knew how to sing the woman," added Lourenço do Rosário. item.title: Hong Kong USA AI to predict Alzheimer's risks through retina images
item.description: A Hong Kong Health Center has developed a system that uses Artificial Intelligence Technologies (AI) to predict the risk of Alzheimer's disease through retinal image analysis, a pioneering advance in the world. The system is not invasively analyzes the bottom images of the eye, detecting early changes in blood vessels and retinal nerves that may be related to Alzheimer's disease, allowing to identify potential risk cases years before clinical symptoms appear. Humansa Medical Center, a longevity-centered health center, has developed the system in collaboration with I-Cognitio Sciences, an ophthalmological technology company at the Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK). The artificial intelligence of i-cognitio has been validated with a vast data set, which includes nearly 13,000 eye background images of 648 patients diagnosed with Alzheimer's and over 3,000 individuals with normal cognition. A study published in 2022 in Lancet Digital Health, demonstrated that artificial intelligence technology developed to detect Alzheimer's risk reaches an accuracy of 80 percent to 92 percent in multi -deed populations from various countries. Dementia affects about one third of people over 85 in the Asia Pacific region, according to recent data. In Hong Kong, dementia affects 10 percent of the population over 70 years old and Alzheimer's disease is responsible for more than half of diagnosed cases. Scientific studies underline that up to 45 percent of dementia cases could be avoided or delayed through early interventions, stressing the importance of early detection to mitigate the impact of dementia on the population. However, conventional cognitive tests and brain structural imaging have limited accuracy, while advanced methods such as amyloid pet and cerebrospinal fluid analysis are invasive and less accessible to the general population. Crucial action In this context, this study has developed a model based on deep learning with an approach that promises to offer “a simple, low -cost and poorly laborious solution” to identify potential patients in community environments and provide adequate accuracy and sensitivity. In an effort to highlight AI relevance in the diagnosis and health care of the brain, Vincent Mok, director and founder of I-Cognitio, highlighted the fundamental role of the retina as a window to the brain. According to Mok, "through non -invasive eye photography, it is possible to identify changes in retinal blood vessels and retinal nerves linked to Alzheimer's disease." The expert explained that these changes in the retina may manifest themselves 10 to 15 years before Alzheimer's clinical symptoms are evident, which represents a crucial opportunity for early intervention.

item.title: Facilitated entry to foreigners through the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge
item.description: The Public Security Police body announced that tourists from 82 countries, including Portugal, Brazil and Cape Verde, will be able to enter the region through the largest sea bridge in the world, without having to leave the vehicle. The measure comes into force today on the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau bridge and covers all visitors from the 82 entry-expected countries, CPSP said. In a statement issued on Thursday, police said that all foreign tourists “armed with a valid passport”, regardless of nationality, will be able to leave Macao and enter the bridge without leaving the vehicle. The goal of the police is to "promote international cultural exchange and help Macau become an open platform abroad (…) and an important window for the exchange between Chinese and Western civilizations." Police added that the measure, which covers vehicles that can transport up to nine people, was decided “after an in -depth evaluation of the demand for entry and exit” at the Bridge Border post. To the other bank The Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge, the world's longest maritime crossing, registered more than 172,000 foreign passengers by the end of April, an increase of 70 percent compared to the same period of 2024. “This increase is largely due to the expansion of visa exemption policies by China, and Zhuhai's terrestrial border post is the only one in continental territory Chinese that offers direct road access to Hong Kong International Airport, ”Chinese state news agency Xinhua said. At the end of April, the Secretary for Macao Security announced plans to accelerate the border control of foreign visitors, without resident status or work authorization, through the use of automatic electronic channels. Authorities will expand self-service equipment to the biometric data collection system, which will apply to all foreign visitors, explained Wong Sio Chak. The secretary added that the government will study the extension of iris recognition technology in non -resident border controls in 2025.

Therefore, the heroism of the discoveries, living in the Christian faith, but accompanied and protected by the Renaissance Belling that recovers the classic spirit and deities, such as the protective Venus, a loving deity that sails for the Portuguese, and the aggressive and jealous Bacchus, the god of wine who wants to lose them. The latter, if effectively fulfilling his 14 -year mission, escapes the wheel of reincarnation (Jenner, 1994: 60), and his disciples, disobedient divine forces falling into the human world, will be able to return to heaven, where they will again occupy divine positions. First Sun Wukong (孙悟空 Sūn Wǔkōng), by King's disobedient monkey transits the obedient guardian of the Buddhist religion. Guanyin will free this indomitable spirit, prisoner in the mountain of the five elements (五行山 wǔxing shān), as punishment for the disobediences they have no account. Then a heavenly marshal who will pass the pig. He is Marshal Tian Peng (天篷 Tiān Péng) of the Milky Way, tried to seduce the Divinity of the Moon, was punished by the emperor of Jade with axes and condemned to exile on earth. Bodhisattva baptized him with the nickname of Zhu Bajie (猪八戒 Zhū Bājiè), which means "Pig of the eight abstinences," and gave him the name Buddhist of Zhu Wuneng (猪悟能 Zhū Wǔnéng), ie "awakening pork for power" (1994: 63). There will be an ogre that will be dominated and transformed into a sand monk. He was punished for being a distracted heavenly general. He paid the distraction with 800 whipping, having been exiled to Earth, where he devours travelers hidden in the waters of the floating river. Guanyin frees him, baptizing him with the nickname "sand" (沙 shā), and the Buddhist name of Wujing (牾净 Wǔjìng), which means "awake to purity." Follows is the son of the West Sea Dragon King who will be metamorphosed on a white horse. He was denounced by his own father for burning the bright pearls of the palace. Jade emperor punished him, suspending him in the air. He gave him 300 whips, letting him wait for death. Prince Dragon is freed to turn into the white horse of the Xuánzàng monk, or as he is known in Chinese, on the white-dragon horse, (白龙马 白龙马 Lóng Mǎ). In the term of the pilgrimage, Zhu Wuneng spiritualized, ascends to heaven, being rewarded with the heavenly position of cleans. (Jenner, 1994: 58). Therefore, Buddha wanted to distribute the Scriptures through the Chinese world. Mutatis Mutandis Zhu Bajie, the eight abstinence pig, and Sun Wugong, the west -west -awake to emptiness, have many of the opposite and complementary characteristics we find in D. Quixote and Sancho Pança. To confirm it, be aware of some of the said proverbials associated with King Monkey: 1) The seventy -two transformations of the monkey king (七十二变 qī shí èr bàn) 2) endless mutations (千变万化 qiān biàn wàn huà) 3) great confusion in the heavenly palace (大闹天宮 大闹天宮 nao tiān gōng) 4) Infinite Magic Powers (神通广大 Shéntōng-Guǎnggdà) 5) Appears and mysteriously disappears (神出鬼没 Shénchū-guǐmò) He has an infinite spiritual ability, which allows him to accompany the universal movement and be in permanent transformation. It has numerous magical powers, learned from the best of Taoist masters, which enables him to successfully interfere in both the heavenly and earthly order, which is why he will be punished and only subjugated by the Buddha himself, which, tame it reveals it belongs to a superior spiritual and religious order. After a five hundred -year -old punishment, inflicted by the Buddhism patriarch, will be able to join the group of pilgrims that will successfully introduce sutras and Buddhist teachings in China. Sun Wugong reveals to be a complex and multifaceted character, retaining and enhancing the best and worst of human nature in his portentous intelligence, challenging and disobedient. It has a lot of difficulty in dealing with Zhu Bajie, for the stupidity and lust of the partner, always ready to sloth out and surrender to exclusively carnal pleasures. Zhu Bajie embodies some of the typical defects of human nature that are well revealed in the popular proverbial philosophy, as can be seen by some of the said mentioned: 1) Zhū Bájiè fails and never assumes his responsibilities (豬八戒上陈 Zhū Bájiè Shàng Chén) 2) Zhu Bajie is adorned with flowers (豬八戒戴花 Zhū Bájiè dài huā). 3) Zhū Bájiè is the mirror (CZHū Bájiè Kàn Jìngzi) 4) Zhū Bájiè departed by plane (豬八戒坐飞机 Zhū Bájiè Zuò Fēijī). In the first proverb, there is the difficulty of the pig to assume guilt whenever it makes mistakes, and how to make mistakes is human, there are no accounts at the times when shaking responsibilities; Already in the second is denounced a very characteristic defect between the people, the vanity, that is, the constant need for ornaments, and not only from the physical point of view, because here not only counts the clothing but also the titles, positions and honors, in a total inability to strictly self -evaluate. In the third said, the physical and moral fealade, which attracts complaints from others, for the lack of composure and, finally, this expression is used when someone goes to the best, but in a worse way, that is, without dignity. Finally, here are some more generally meaningful proverbs, taken from the west pilgrimage, who draw attention to the general evils of the world through the adventures of pilgrims, since, except Sun Wugong, others are very easily fooled by all kinds of monsters, demons, seductive spirits, etc., having great difficulty unraveling hypocritical behaviors in which they stumble through Journey, where they find “many guys to which they cannot see their hearts” or, in other words, abundant hypocrisy, as said (虚情假意 xū qing jiǎ yì). Therefore, they are constantly involved in sarilhos or situations that “have no feet or head”, which is literally translated into Chinese by “unequal sizes” (七长八短 qīm tea bā duān). Now in a misleading world, pilgrims are those who with good intentions go with the greatest goal of saving China, so the group finds itself in the situation of “big ship, great storm”, or as it is said in Chinese, “great tree that attracts the wind” (树大招风 shūo fēng) in a world where when virtue grows a few centimeters, so wickedness increases several meters (， ， ， ， ， ， ， Give gāo yī chǐ, mó gāo yī zhàng). item.title: Environment | Macau registers a new maximum temperatures in 2024
item.description:
The direction of environmental protection services yesterday launched new data on the environmental landscape in the territory, in the Macao Encounters of the Macao 2024. The data is not encouraging: last year a new record of maximum temperatures, more rain and typhoons were recorded. More electricity and water was spent, more garbage was produced and fewer recyclable waste was collected
Lame The Government of Macao, through the Directorate of Environmental Protection Services (DSPA) announced yesterday that 2024 reached a maximum temperature record in the territory, and there was also an increase in typhoons and precipitation. According to the Macau 2024 state report, the average temperature last year was 23.6 ° C, precisely the value that had been reached in 2019, the highest since the records began, in 1952. The average temperature of 2024 was 0.8 ° C higher than the average climacteric (average of 30 years, between 1991 and 2020), according to the document prepared by DSPA. In addition, Macau registered 42 days considered to be hot last year, more 10.7 days than the climacteric average, 29 hot nights, 17.5 than the average, and 29 cold days, less 10.1 days than the average. Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) classify as hot days when the maximum temperature is equal to or greater than 33ºC and the nights at which the minimum temperature is at least 28ºC. As for the days considered cold, they are those at which the minimum temperature does not exceed 12ºC. "With global warming, the occurrence of extreme weather phenomena is increasingly frequent," said DSPA in the report. In 2024, Macau was affected by seven tropical cyclones, known as tuffons, and for the first time three tropical cyclones affected Macao in November, the last month of the typhoons, which begins in May. According to the report, the region received last year a total precipitation of 2,029.2 mm, "slightly higher than the climacteric average." DSPA also said that since 1970, sea level in Macao has risen at an average rate of about 3.5 millimeters per year. Also worldwide, 2024 was the hottest year that there are records and exceeded for the first time the 1.5 ° C above the pre-industrial level, in January the copernicus European service advanced in January. Last week, the world weather organization predicted that temperatures should continue to reach record values ​​by the end of the decade. More people, more expenses The DSPA report also tells that with the arrival of more tourists to Macau, there were also more waste and spending on water consumption, for example. "With the improvement of the economy, the number of visitors in 2024 increased 23.8 percent in annual terms for almost 35 million, having recovered about 90 percent of the pre-pound level. Tourist intensity also registered a certain increase, with GDP [Gross Domestic Product] climbed 8.8 percent. In addition, there was a slight increase in the population at the end of the year." Thus, it is added, "in relation to environmental indicators, economic and population growth led to the rise of estimated local emissions of greenhouse gases, invoiced water volume, electricity consumption and the amount of urban solid waste, compared to 2023". "During the pandemic, there was a decrease in the various economic and environmental indicators. However, with the constant improvement of the economy, most of these indicators rose again," is explained. With regard to the volume of invoiced water, in thousands of cubic meters, by 2023 the record was 89,164 and last year, 94.123, which constitutes an increase of 5.6 percent. Regarding electricity consumption, in millions of kW/h, in 2023 it was 5,740, while in 2024 consumption went to 6,030, plus 5.1 percent. The report also highlights the tons of urban solid waste produced, which in 2023 was 501,512, rising 5.1 percent last year to 526,979 tons. Another worrying fact of waste level was the fall, for the third consecutive year, the volume of recyclable waste collected, which went from 24.5 percent at 2021 to 21.7 percent last year. Changed for kids, of all recyclable waste generated in Macao, only about one fifth are collected for recycling. In the report, IP Kuong Lam, director of DSPA, indicates that last year, "with the ongoing economic recovery, there was greater pressure on various environmental indicators, while climate change became more severe." Despite the results, the official said that the objectives are "to encourage greater participation of the population in environmental initiatives and together to achieve the view of building a macao with low carbon emissions." A question of gases The report released yesterday by DSPA also accounts for the panorama of greenhouse gases (GHG) gases, and last year, a global increase of “about ten percent, including carbon dioxide (C02), which represented 90 percent”. It also highlights DSPA that “the estimated emissions of GHE from the various sources have registered upon the same period (2023), except for landfill residues, and the most significant increases were verified in estimated emissions from local electricity production and air transport”. In addition, it is stated that, in 2024, the main source of Emission of GHG and CO2 was land transport, followed by local electricity production, waste incineration, trade, domestic consumption and services. "The main sources of CH4 emissions [methane] were the waste deposited in landfills and the treatment of wastewater, while the latter was also the main source of N2O emission [nitrous oxide]," he stresses in the document. DSPA clarifies, regarding the tendency of GHG emissions, that "after reaching the peak in 2017, local Emissions of GHG showed a decreasing tendency, year after year, having reached its lower value during the pandemic." However, with the recovery of economic activities and the great movement of people, especially "in the last two years, the estimated emissions of these gases has gradually rise again." The air we breathe Also with regard to air quality data is not encouraging, because in 2024 “the number of days with the average quality of air classified as 'good' or 'moderate' recorded in the six Macao air quality monitoring stations reached 88 percent, slightly lower than 2023”. There was, in a total of the year, 15 to 34 days with “unhealthy” classification, and only two days obtained the classification of “very unhealthy”. According to DSPA, “the pollutants detected in the air monitoring stations were mainly ozone (O3) and thin particles suspended (PM2.5)”, while “at Berma da Estrada station (Ká-Hó), the highest index detected all year round, classified as 'very unhealthy', was the O3 the main pollutant”. Last year, July was the best air quality month, while October to December obtained the worst qualification according to data from Macao air monitoring stations. The report also reveals that “in terms of compliance with atmospheric pollutant concentrations in 2024, average annual PM10 and PM2.5 concentrations recorded in the various monitoring stations were lower than standard values”, while “the average annual nitrogen dioxide concentrations (NO2) also set below standard values, except for Road Berma measures (Macao) and at the High Density Areas station (Macau) ”. More optimistic data is also revealed “daily averages of sulfur dioxide concentrations (SO2) and the maximum averages of eight hours of carbon monoxide concentrations (CO) verified in the various stations throughout the year”, as “both were below standard values”. “In all seasons there was a record of the maximum averages of eight hours of O3 concentrations to exceed standard values ​​in some days. In relation to atmospheric pollutant concentrations recorded in the monitoring stations, generally the average annual concentrations of PM2.5 and NO2, while PM10 and CO descended”, and “as in the road station season (Macao) Only in 2024 did SO2 and O3 begin to be monitored, no comparisons were made. ”

item.title: Cooperation | A look at the approach to Spanish -speaking countries
item.description:
The MSAR was already approaching Spain, but the chief executive began to refer to official speeches the importance of cooperation between Macao and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as the usual Lusophone world. Analysts relate these words to the current panorama of relations between China and Spain
The chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, has expressed in some discourses the importance of having to establish economic and commercial relations not only with Portuguese -speaking countries, but also with Spanish -speaking ones. Last month, on a public occasion, the government leader stated that the territory has to "welcome foreign friends to invest in Macau and also to realize his dreams in Macao." Sam Hou Fai highlighted the area of ​​advanced technology, stressing that “they can come from Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries” because “as long as they are in favor of economic diversification, they are always welcome,” he added. Moreover, after the inauguration of the new government, Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, made, in March, a visit to several European countries, leading a delegation that passed through Spain, Portugal, Belgium and Monaco to deepen “international links and explore opportunities for cooperation”, according to official information released at the time. This approach to the Spanish -language universe, in addition to the usual connection already established between China and the Lusophone world, can have several origins: the growing relationship between China and Spain, as well as the desire to diversify the economy by MSAR, say analysts contacted by HM. “The interpretation of Sam Hou Fai Declaration is very objective and pragmatic and can be summed up to the Macao economy diversification project, for which companies and investors are not only in Macao, but also from Portuguese-speaking countries. But the fact is that companies and institutions in Portuguese-speaking countries are not being effective in response to this need for Macao. For cooperation it seems logical to me, ”said economist Maria Fernanda Ilhéu, former resident of Macao and president of the Friends Association of the New Seda Route (ARS). According to the leader, “Macau is a pure market economy, is classified by the World Trade Organization as a free port with its own international agreements both in the economic, commercial, investment, financial, health, sports, sports, international relations agreements with various organizations. Therefore, the business in Macau is very free, and the part of the government of Macau is to promote and frame this opening”. "As Sam Hou Fai says, all companies and investors who bring Macao economy diversification solutions are welcome," he added. To Cátia Miriam Costa, professor at ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, and specialist in Chinese foreign policy and Macao, considered the HM that “this connection to the Spanish stems from the high -level official visits made by the Spanish government to China, that is, there is certainly one of the consequences of the repeated presence of Spanish diplomacy on a very high level, reinforcing the ties between the two. countries ”. THE IMPORTANCE OF GLOBAL SOUTH It is true that Beijing, in the words of President XI Jinping, has shown great interest in the approach of the countries of the so -called “global south”, where Portuguese and Spanish speaks, essentially. For Cátia Miriam Costa, here also resides another explanation for the change of paradigm in the field of commercial and economic cooperation. "It seems to me that recent meetings with high Spanish political representatives have influenced this decision, along with China's increasing political investment in the global south where Portuguese and Spanish are, in fact, the most spoken languages." For Académica, "the strategy of using Macau as a convergence point may be historically justified by its cosmopolitanism, but also by its traditional role in including the routes that connected Asia to Latin America." In addition, "adds to a historical perspective, a contemporary view for a region that needs economic diversification and benefits from this proximity to distant spaces, whether historical or culturally." Cátia Miriam Costa understands, therefore, that "Spanish can be seen as an additional value to Portuguese, without distorting the paradiplomacy strategy defined for Macao early on." The inclusion of Equatorial Guinea in the Macao Forum cannot be ignored, as a result of its entry to the CPLP - community of Portuguese -speaking countries. However, Cátia Miriam Costa believes that this change has little or nothing to do with the inclusion of Spanish -speaking countries in the official commercial approach discourse. "The inclusion of Equatorial Guinea in the Macao Forum stems from another circumstance, that of his participation as a member of the CPLP. In this sense, it was a logical step to its integration into the dynamics of the Forum. However and although it can count as a positive element in this approach, the leverage that Equatorial Guinea has in the Hispanic or Hispanic speaking world," he pointed out. ASES BY ARE Maria Fernanda Ilhéu also highlighted the fact that the only direct air connection between Macao and Europe will be for Madrid and not to Lisbon. “By chance, TAP or the Portuguese government have contacted Air Macau or the Macao government expressing interest in resuming this airline? I don't know, but I know that this connection will greatly contribute to strengthening the Spanish presence in Macao, whether in tourism, commerce or investment.” The guardian highlights the complementarity factor of the air route. "Is the Portuguese and Spanish presence in Macau is incompatible? It doesn't look like, but it is competitive, it may even be beneficial if they know how to collaborate and gain scale in the Great Bay area, but Portugal has to strive more to their presence in Macau is not a historic relic." Moreover, the economist does not forget the role that Portuguese foreign policy may play in this issue, with the removal of Huawei in Portugal and a closer approach to Beijing in recent times. “Portugal's decision banning the use of Huawei equipment says mainly respect for the economic relations of Portugal with mainland China and it is framed by a fearful diplomatic relationship that the Portuguese government followed from 2019 to 2024, contrary to the Spanish diplomatic relationship. It should be noted that the Spanish Prime Minister visited China several times during this period and the Portuguese government alone was represented by the foreign business minister. At the Boao Forum in Hainan, with a brief pass for Beijing. ” Thus, Maria Fernanda Ilhéu understands that between 2019 and 2024 “the Portuguese government and the Portuguese civil society were very conditioned by the American narrative of cold war and the formation of two antagonistic blocks, not knowing how to keep the line followed by 2019 to proceed with a relationship with China supported by the friendship and confidence of nearly 500 years of cooperation in Macau”. The necessary work For the economist and president of ANSRs, it is necessary to take into account the investments and business movements made in recent times to perceive the position of Portugal and Spain in this domain. “The last major investment of a large Chinese company in Portugal was registered in 2020, and only now is this type of investment with Calb investment [SINE Battery producer] that is in the implementation and licensing phase. If we see the same type of investments in Spain from 2020 to 2024 we can record five major energy investments, by China Three Gorges and Huadian; Transport, Geely, Chery Auto and Envision Group; a major investment in agriculture by Yankuang Beijing Energy and also a major investment in the health sector by Worg Pharmaceuticals. ” For the official, “a lot of work will have to be done by the new Portuguese government to develop Portuguese economic cooperation with mainland China and MSAR, but it will also have to be accompanied by Portuguese business fabric,” he said.

item.title: Pecunaries Checks | Former Beneficiaries defend better assignment criteria
item.description:
Given the changes to the pecuniary reimbursement plan, HM has heard three permanent residents who will no longer receive the check because they do not reside permanently in Macao, including a macanese born in the territory. Arnaldo Gonçalves, academic and former Beneficiary, defends a better distribution of support depending on the income of families
The rules for the attribution of pecuniary checks will change and now it is really necessary to be 183 days a year in the territory. The exceptions are some and arrest with students from Macau who are attending courses abroad or residents to work remotely to Macau and who are enrolled in the Social Security Fund, among other situations. However, many people will be left out, even though they have lived for several decades in the territory or even macanese born in Macau, that is, many of the members of the Macanese diaspora. In the case of Arnaldo Gonçalves, a permanent resident resident in Lisbon, he lived several decades in Macau, having worked for the government and was a university professor in the area of ​​political science. Six years ago, he returned to Portugal, being renovated, and told HM that he was already waiting for the day he was going to stop receiving the ten thousand dates annually. "This measure aims to give people a counterpart, given the difficulties existing in consumption and the characteristics of life. I don't live in Macau, and I think from the point of view of equity, the government has never been able to make a fairer regime from the distributive point of view, because there is no system of attribution from the income, and deep down there are multimillionaires that gain the subseck, like the pensioners, all," he said. This is what Arnaldo Gonçalves says "lament". "It is hard work to make an assessment of people's economic possessions, and so everyone receives the same as it is more practical in administrative terms," ​​he said. Maria João Ferreira, macaense of gem, daughter of the famous poet Adé, will also fail to receive the pecuniary check. He says he understands, but also criticizes the executive's positions. "I was already waiting and accepted with all the tranquility. It is fair, since I do not live there and I have the chance to be 183 days. I thank the time of checks that was dismissed. I lived in Macau until I was 16, but I was born there and still have family. Even the pandemic was there every year of vacation. mentioned. Maria João Ferreira, currently in the direction of Macao's house in Lisbon, says she was “shocked” with a very concrete case. "A few years ago, when he was doing his doctorate, he learned of a civil servant who did two service committees in Macao and was a contemplated BIR money and even told me, not just me, that I thought it was funny as he was there so recently, he was entitled to such a benefit," he said. "This is what I think is bad. It is one thing to go to do a service committee in public administration, or two or three, but it was never, in fact, resident. It is, as it were, an immigrant, because it will only work. This is how I see things," he added. Patacas Amealdas For Arnaldo Gonçalves, the ten thousand annual patacas served as a “Management Fund” for trips to the territory, where he still has family and where he travels frequently. "I've never used this money for personal purposes, you know? But I think these changes are a good measure, justifiable, and I even think it's selfish, that I've been entitled to this support for so many years. There are other people who need it," he said. In the case of Maria João Ferreira, the cash of the pecuniary check was also used for expenses in Macao and with trips to the territory. "I have an account in Macao, and when I went there, if I needed to buy the plane ticket, my sister said the money here, or this money served to fund my stay in Macao," he explained. Sofia Mota, a permanent resident and former Maradora in Macao, regrets the absence of explanations for these changes. "It depends on what the pecuniary check is for, whether it is a way of distributing the wealth or profits of casinos to the people who are part of the territory, or have already done; either if it is a condition to be part of the territory. I do not realize the premise in which the pecuniary check measure is based, and depending on the premise these changes may be more or less acceptable." The teacher considers that "it makes no sense that those who contribute to social security at their own initiative, as is my case, are not covered." "It seems that there is a first and second and second social security system. People who come to Portugal to provide family care seem not to be covered and yet are out of the territory for reasons of force majeure. What is meant by providing subsistence to family members, is not realizing the function of the check and the coherence of exceptions," he said. Sofia Mota confesses that she also used money to "a management fund to go to Macau, or to invest in formation." The first reactions The changes to the pecuniary reimbursement program were presented at the end of May and report that three groups will be exempt from the obligation to be 183 days a year in Macao and thus receive the check. They are the residents under 22 in 2024 and where one parent meets the requirements for receiving the check; the beneficiaries of the disability pension and the beneficiaries of disability allowance. There are eight other situations where residents may have access to the check. This is what happens when residents attend higher education outside the territory; When they are hospitalized in a hospital outside the sons, those who are over 65 and live in the interior of China or, even under 65, have health reasons that justify the permanence inside China. Residents who work outside Macao are also covered by the exceptions to an employer registered at the MSAR Social Security Fund and residents outside the MSAR who are responsible for the family aggregate subsistence. These are also attached to the exercise of official functions outside Macao; the registration of domicile, work or study in the deepened cooperation zone; And yet the work done in the cities of large bay except Hong Kong that is left out. Deputy Pereira Coutinho manifested against the changes to the pecuniary check referring to violate the Macao Basic Law, namely in article 25, which guarantees the equality of the residents of Macao before the law and prohibits discrimination. The article determines that "the residents of Macao are equal before the law, without discrimination due to nationality, ancestry, race, gender, language, religion, political or ideological convictions, economic instruction and situation or social condition." More recently, the Macao Synergy Association publicly stated that changes to the pecuniary reimbursement plan in economic development are not in accordance with the wishes of the population. Ron Lam also criticized the executive for applying the changes “in a hurry” which only came to cause more controversy: “the government was in a hurry and applied a sudden measure, without making any public consultation, with only behind -the -scenes movements leading to the population to question governance,” he said. "Consultations with local associations were simulated, which only generated more criticism and caused more unnecessary controversy," he added.

item.title: EU has to be “much more vocal” about Israel in Gaza
item.description: Former European doctor Elisa Ferreira demanded yesterday to the European Union to be “much more vocal” about the boundaries that Israel “is surpassing” in the war against Hamas, defending an articulated voice of the community bloc. "Europe, even because of all the defense of human rights, has to be much more vocal to saying to Israel that it cannot exceed the boundaries it is exceeding, and that current international agreements do not allow certain actions," Elisa Ferreira said in statements to Lusa after a conference at the Consulate General of Portugal in Macau. However, the academic noted that Member States have never attributed competencies to the European Union in defense that allow it, for example, to intervene with armament in cases of country invasions. "That said, many countries-Ireland, Spain-they moved a lot, and I think there is a joint and joint voice to prevent us with a sense of impotence in the face of deaths that are absolutely unacceptable in the 21st century," said the former Minister of the Environment (1995-1999) and the planning and territorial planning (1999-2002) in the governments of António Guterres. Elisa Ferreira stressed that there have already been “there were some expressions of this will” by Lisbon and expects “to keep up”. PEACE STEPS In late May, Slovenia, Spain, Ireland and Norway, who recognized the Palestinian state a year ago, appealed to all countries to do the same compared to Palestine and Israel, as it is a necessary step for peace in the region. "We remember that recognition is another step towards the implementation of the solution of both states and we appeal to the international community to take the necessary steps to make it a reality, among them, the individual recognition of Palestine and Israel by the countries that have not yet done it," reads a "joint statement." Israel's retaliation for Hamas' attack on October 7 caused more than 54,000 dead, the destruction of almost all Gaza strip infrastructures and the forced displacement of hundreds of thousands of people. Elisa Ferreira wants to look for new partners like China Former European doctor Elisa Ferreira defended Lusa yesterday that the European Union must rethink partnerships and look for new interlocutors, including Beijing, to keep “a great actor” on the international scenario. "If there is an opportunity in every crisis, as I think the Chinese say, there is also an opportunity in this US leadership crisis, because it has shown that Europe has to know where it wants to go and not lose control over its own agenda, and, on the other hand, it has to diversify partners abroad," said Lusa, the former Portuguese minister, after a conference at the Consulate General of Portugal. In the current context of instability, China “has to be a great partner,” said the academic. "China is a great power. I think it has always been latent, now it is completely affirmed, especially in future areas, in stories of new digital and environmental technologies." "For a long time, Europe wanted to be driving out of new clean energy, energy savings technologies, etc.; I think China, when it defines it, when it determines, when it is organized, accelerates with an unstoppable speed," he noticed. In Macao at an invitation from the Institute of European Studies, Elisa Ferreira inaugurated yesterday the “conversations in the Consulate” cycle, with the lecture “Portugal: from the successes of the democratic Portugal to the crossroads of the present”.

item.title: Dsal | Number of occupational accidents suffers slight breakdown in annual terms
item.description: Data related to occupational accidents last year reveal stability compared to 2023: about five thousand people, 5,095, suffered accidents at work, slightly less than 5,293 victims of 2023, while the number of deadly victims arising from these incidents remained in a dozen Photo: Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro Data released on Friday by the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL) show how in the space of one year, between 2023 and 2024, the panorama of occupational accidents remained stable, and even a light break in the number of occurrences and the same number of dead. According to the report related to 2024, a total of 5,095 workers suffered an accident at work, and the main cause was the “fall of people”, which represented the 25.4 percent bar of the total of incidents, followed by the “raising in or between objects”, which represented 19.3 percent of all incidents, and the “march or shock in objects”, with 16.1 percent. According to the DSAL report released last year, there were 5,293 victims of occupational accidents in 2023, and almost all occurrences (5,253) resulted in temporary work disability. Only 30 cases resulted in the person's permanent disability, and 10 people died. Last year, DSAL also recorded the same number of deaths from occupational accidents, and a case is associated with an alleged “infringement of occupational safety and health legislation”. "All mortal cases were sent to the court organs for due processing, and, later, DSAL will adjust the data in accordance with the judgments given," reads the report relating to 2024. DSSA says investigations to all labor incidents, having applied fines to two entities for “infringements to occupational safety and health” in cases involving two workers. In addition, fines to 43 persons were applied for infringement of the legal regime of reparation for emerging damages of occupational accidents and occupational diseases, involving 303 workers in total. More men than women The report also presents more specific data on occupational accidents last year. Thus, of the 5,095 cases, 5,063 resulted in temporary disability, and 557 workers managed to return to service on the same day of the occurrence of the accident highlights DSal. However, a total of 22 people ended up having permanent disability. Noteworthy is the number of people who were hit in the hands (1,336), followed by accidents in the feet zone with 894 occurrences, various parts of the body with 831 cases, and accidents in the trunk zone with 743 cases. Statistical data also show that men dominate with regard to victims: thus, in 2024, 255 victims aged between 16 and 24 years. In this age group, 165 men suffered occupational accidents as opposed to 90 women. The numbers rise in people aged 25 to 44, in which there were 2,719 occurrences, reaching 1,568 men and 1,151 women. From 45 to 64 there were 1,908 occurrences, this time, more women than men: 1,188 compared to 720 male workers. Highlight for 213 cases of occupational accidents involving people at renovation age, ie 65 years or older, where 120 women were affected in contrast with 93 men. The 2024 data also look at the type of profession in which more accidents occurred: dominate the “administrative employees”, with 1,318 cases, followed by the “staff of services, sellers and similar work”, with 1,207 cases, as well as “unqualified workers” with 1,219 occurrences. There were also 413 occurrences in the group of “workers of industrial production and artisans” and 196 in “operators of machines, drivers and assemblers”. In the category of “intermediate level technicians and professionals” were registered 420 work incidents. Let's go by parts If we look at the numbers of occupational accidents taking into account the branch of economic activity, it is observed that they dominate “cultural and recreational activities, lottery and other services”, therefore, to the game and entertainment sector, with 1,512 cases occurred last year. Following are accidents in “hotels, restaurants and the like”, with 1,293 cases, as well as 414 incidents in the area of ​​“transport, storage and communications”. In the construction sector, there were 374 accidents. It should be noted that the 2023 data is also similar in terms of economic activity where more work accidents occurred and in terms of the gender of workers, with 52 percent of men and 48 percent of affected women. In 2023, there was a higher incidence of occupational accidents in ages between 25 and 44 years, representing 53.6 percent, while at the age of 45 and 64 years, the percentage of accidents lowered to 37.2 percent. The 2023 DSal report also showed that “cultural and recreational activities, lottery and other services” (29.5 percent), “hotels, restaurants and the like” (23.2 percent) and “transport, storage and communications” (10.8 percent) occupied the first three positions compared to the total number of occupational accident victims. Regarding the professions, the “unqualified workers” (26 percent), the “staff of services, sellers and similar workers” (24 percent) and the “administrative employees” (22.9 percent) occupied the first three positions in relation to the total victims of occupational accidents. Action and reaction The 2024 DSA DSA report also reveals that 3,550 inspection visits were made to different workplaces, such as construction shipyards, industrial and commercial establishments, which resulted in 395 improvement recommendations and fines in 10 situations due to lack of safety. Last year, four suspensions of the operation of shipyards were ordered in the context of occupational safety and health verification, the most serious consequence after the application of fines or awareness. Dsal also points out that, last year, 404 seminars were performed for different sectors and types of work, which had the participation of 17,148 people. Regarding courses on occupational safety and health, formations were carried out to obtain the occupational security card in the construction, with 26,590 participants, which resulted in the issuance of 25,069 cards. The “Safety Training Courses in Specific Construction Works” had 3,167 participants, and 2,895 certificates were issued. In another important area for the local economy, hotel and restoration, 25,965 participants participated in the “training courses to obtain the occupational safety card in hotel and restoration”, with the issuance of 25,020 cards.

item.title: Physical Fitness | Study shows good results in preschool children
item.description:
One study analyzed the physical fitness of preschool children in Macao. The results point to “modest growth and development”, “small increases in height and weight” and “improvements in speed, agility, muscle strength and flexibility”, thanks to the 2015 curriculum reform that bet on school sports
The government is to be congratulated with regard to sports in preschool, according to an academic study that evaluated children of kindergartens and statistical data of their physical fitness provided by the Institute of Sport (ID). In "Temporal Trends of Physical Fitness in MSAR preschool children between 2002 and 2020", published in the Journal of Exercise & Fitness, academics point to "modest growth and development among preschool students." Statistically evaluated parameters focus on performance in activities such as running, length jump or march. The work is by SIU Ming Choi, Faculty of Education, Grant R. Tomkinson, Justin J. Lang, Cristina Cadenas-Sanchez, Haoyu Dong, Si Man Lei, Eric Tsz Chun Poon, the latter linked to the Department of Sports Sciences and Physical Education at the Chinese University of Hong Kong. The authors have taken the annual ID data to realize how the children's body has evolved in recent years, allowing you to perceive data related to weight, height and body measurements. Thus, it is read that there were “small increases in height, weight and circumferences, improvements in speed-agility, muscle strength and flexibility of the lower body and flexibility, and declines in the muscle power of the upper body and equilibrium capacity”. The study reveals "significant but small increases at the time, weight and circumference of the chest," while "the physical aptitude trends were contradictory, with declines ranging from insignificant to small throwing and equilibrium performance." There were also “insignificant improvements to small in other measures” of the body, with the authors to point out that “no significant differences were found between genres, which indicates equitable development” between boys and girls. In general terms, “an increase in body size and modest but significant improvements in various components of physical fitness, such as speed-agility, muscle power, and flexibility, and flexibility, and declines elsewhere” were recorded. The authors consider that these results “can be attributed to a combination of factors of the education system and the domestic environment”, as “the Macao Education System and the curriculum guidelines have given priority to the development of physical education and the acquisition of motor skills”. It is also noteworthy that Macau was "the first region of China to incorporate kindergarten in its free education system since 2007, making the education of its residents a fundamental priority." The study also mentions the 2015 curriculum reform, which “explicitly emphasizes learning fundamental movement skills, such as locomotor (walking, running, bouncing, equilibrium, trigger) and object control (launch, catch) through various physical activities and games designed by teachers”. The work emphasizes the importance of guardians in the connection of children with sport, remembering the pandemic years. “Parents' positive influence on the modeling of physical activity can also play a role in these improvements, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic, when children had less opportunities for physical activity away from home.” Academics emphasize that it is important, for the authorities, to make a “continuous monitoring” and “support the physical fitness and overall health in early childhood”, and there must be “strategies to improve global physical fitness in early childhood”. Jump and jump For this study, data from children between the age of three and the age of five were analyzed in preschool, in 2002, 2005, 2010, 2015 and 2020, such as body size, with regard to height, weight and circumferences of the chest, waist and hip; And physical fitness, such as the 2 × 10 m shot, foot length heel, marching, continuous two -legged heel, head throttle and sitting and reaching. ” In addition, "preschool children of six macaoal gardens were recruited through a combination of stratified and group random sampling methods." A total of 4,519 children, with 59 percent boys and 41 percent girls participated. The results reveal “an equitable improvement of physical fitness” and the data put Macau at a better position on some European countries referred to in the study. “In contrast to previous investigations into the trends of the physical development of children and adolescents in Poland, which revealed stability at the time, but increases in weight and body mass index, our results suggest that macao preschool children have increased in size, perhaps due to the best living and nutritional conditions.” Academics conclude that "results are particularly significant," and point out that "the improvement observed in the performance of the standing length of the Macao preschool is encouraging." Such "contrasts with the investigation into similar populations in the Czech Republic and Poland, where declines were reported in the performance in the length of standing length with increases in the body mass index and in the cutaneous fold", is indicated. Other signs The study also reveals “a temporal improvement of flexibility in Macao preschoolers, which differs from the trends observed in pole preschoolers”, and there are “cultural, environmental factors or other factors that influence the development of flexibility in young children in different regions and populations”. The work also points out that the masters “mixtures uniquely mix eastern and western cultures, which turns it into an intriguing scenario to examine trends in the physical fitness of preschool children”. It is also noted that "the region has a strong commitment to education, offering 15 years of free preschool education to high school and secondary education, ensuring broad access to education and development programs in early childhood childhood for all children." The compliments of the academics continue, stressing the “remarkable life expectancy, which exceeds 84 years in 2019”, and “Macao gave priority to their health and social systems”. “Recognizing the importance of physical health, standardized and systematic physical fitness tests were performed on people of all ages since the beginning of the century, when the government implemented a physical fitness surveillance system aligned with China's national physical fitness monitoring,” is also explained.

item.title: Communities | Emídio Sousa succeeds José Cesário as secretary
item.description:
The new secretary of the Portuguese communities has a governance experience in the environment and for more than 10 years has been mayor of Santa Maria da Feira. In turn, José Cesário will return to the functions of deputy
The Prime Minister of Portugal, Luís Montenegro, chose Emídio Sousa as the new Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities. The replacement of José Cesário, who had resumed these functions last year, and who fulfilled four distinct periods in office, was revealed with the announcement of the members who constitute the new Portuguese executive. The appointment means to Emídio Sousa a change of folder, since in the previous government had performed the functions of Secretary of State for the Environment. The new responsible for the Portuguese communities portfolio has a career essentially linked to policy and public administration. According to his profile on the LinkedIn social network, he has a degree in Public Administration, an area in which he also obtained a master's degree. For about 20 years he worked in the waters of Gaia, where he reached the position of secretary general, and then, in October 2013, assumed the functions of mayor of Santa Maria da Feira, in the district of Aveiro, where he was for about 10 years. Before being elected mayor, he had performed the duties of councilman. “With a quiet conscience” In turn, after becoming a public that was no longer secretary of state of communities, José Cesário left a farewell message on social networks. “It was a great honor for me to have returned to perform these governmental functions in the government led by my friend Luís Montenegro and served the Portuguese resident abroad. It was a very difficult year, full of obstacles, in which, despite everything, it was possible to perform some measures, which I hope to translate into more valuses for those who live outside Portugal,” wrote Cesário. "The choice for a new passport and the expiration of its expiration date, the resolution of the salary problem of our employees in Brazil, the normalization of the activity of the Portuguese Communities Council and the alteration of the association support regime and communication of communities are good examples of this action," he was added. The extension of the passport period from 5 years to 10 years is not yet in force. "Honestly, I leave with a quiet conscience, but with the certainty that there is a lot to do to have a closer and effective relationship with our communities," he said. "Of course, I wish my successor all luck to the world, being sure that, being a wise and hardworking man, everything will do to serve the Portuguese abroad," he said. In place of always Despite leaving the position of Secretary of State, José Cesário will assume the duties of deputy, after being elected by the circle outside Europe. This is a return to a parliament that Cesário has well known and for which he has been successively elected since 1983, with only an interregnum in 2022, first as representative of Aveiro and since 2005 as a representative of communities outside Europe. "From today return to the Assembly of the Republic, as deputy elected from Europe, ceasing my duties of Secretary of State of Portuguese Communities," he wrote. “Now it's time to dedicate myself to parliamentary life, representing with determination, work and humility those who have elected me, whom I owe so much and with whom I have learned so much. Let's go to work!…” Rita Santos regrets “friend” The chairman of the Macao Public Function Association (ATFPM) lamented that the “friend” José Cesário is no longer the Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities. “It was a surprise […] Dr. José Cesário, besides being a secretary of state, is our friend,” he acknowledged in statements to the Macau channel of TDM. "It is more for the human issue, for their ability to communicate with people, to solve the problems, so we have had a good relationship with him. Whether he is in government, or not, he is always willing to help people. We were sad, but we have to look forward," he added. Rita Santos also pointed out that José Cesário will continue to defend the community, now in Parliament. "He is a deputy and I think that with the position of deputy he can continue to fight for the legitimate rights of the Portuguese to live outside Portugal," he said. At the same time, he left wishes to establish a good relationship with the new Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities, Emídio Sousa. "With the new secretary of state we hope that there may be collaboration and good contact, as with Dr. José Cesário, and we wish them the biggest success, to solve the problems of the Portuguese who are quite enough," he said.
