item.title: Elections | Candidate lists fall to less than half
item.description:
The Electoral Commission received at the end of the deadline for nine requests for direct suffrage to the Macao Parliament, less than half than in the previous elections in 2021. The next step will be the presentation of the lists of candidates and political programs by June 26
The Legislative Assembly Electoral Affairs Commission (Caeal) received nine applications from candidate lists to the next legislative elections, less than half of the lists that tried to participate in the 2021 electoral act. There were 19 lists of candidates for the Legislative Assembly (AL), although five lists and 21 candidates -15 of which pro -democracy -were then excluded by “not defending the basic law” being “faithful to the sons”. In a statement issued on Friday, the Electoral Commission stressed that, after finishing the deadline for requesting requests, the candidacy committees that were recognized may submit the list of candidates and political program by June 26. The list will only be “definitely admitted” to the “after passing” elections of the candidates, stressed the electoral body. The State Security Defense Commission will determine "whether candidates defend the basic law and are faithful" to the MSar and issue a binding opinion, of which "there is no complaint or litigation." This State Security Defense Committee will announce, by late, until July 15, the decision on the list of candidates for the legislatures, scheduled for September 14. The Electoral Commission promised to “rigorously” the new electoral law, approved after the 2021 exclusions, “which aims at greater implementation of the Macao principle governed by Patriots”. In good Portuguese On Tuesday, by submitting his application for candidacy, Portuguese deputy José Pereira Coutinho said he was confident that he will not be disqualified, despite being-along with Deputy Ron Lam-one of the few critical voices of the government in AL. "The fact that being critical does not mean that I am not a patriot, I am also patriot," said the former candidate for the Assembly of the Portuguese Republic, in 2015, by the Party We Citizens. “We have always worked here for Macao's good and for the good of the citizens of Macau,” added Pereira Coutinho. Thirty -three deputies are part of AL, 14 of which are elected by direct suffrage, 12 for indirect suffrage through associations, and seven are later appointed by the head of the local government. In the case of the indirect suffrage, the Electoral Commission said it had received six application, more than in 2021, for the five sectors: industrial, commercial and financial; workers; Liberal professionals; social and educational services; and cultural and sports. Four years ago, the 19 initial lists of candidates for direct suffrage had three Lusodescendants. Two of them, José Pereira Coutinho and Lídia Lourenço, were on the Nova Esperança list, linked to the Macao Public Function Workers Association. The third, architect Rui Leão, secretary general of the International Union of Architects, was part of the Civic Observatory list, headed by the then deputy Agnes Lam. Pereira Coutinho did not disclose the composition of the list, but guaranteed the presence of Rita Santos, who requested in October the suspension of the office of the Portuguese communities to prepare the elections. Pereira Coutinho resigned in 2021 to the mandate of a counselor of the Portuguese communities, for which he had been elected in 2015 by the Circle of China, Macao and Hong Kong.

item.title: IDQ / Inspections | Pereira Coutinho criticizes services suspension

item.title: Young people and explored nominations
item.description: Politicians, associations, political parties are not tired of talking about the housing problem. Hollow words and that do not contribute to Portugal the serious problem of housing, especially the social, has a light at the bottom of the tunnel. Portugal is the country in Europe where the price of houses has increased. It is very motionless, but they are luxury condominiums, with access to rich only. The housing intended for affordable incomes is always focused on calendar. And who suffers more from this decision -making inertia of the rulers are the poor and the young. These are still 40 years old living at their parents' home. Young people have no possibility of renting a house in Lisbon or Porto. Its secondary course ends and when they decide to go to a university in Lisbon it is absolutely impossible for them to lease a house and student homes are minimal and expensive. Do you know what happens in Lisbon? Young college students are exploited in an infamous way. In the Capital Lisbon there are hundreds of owners of old houses that were built with six and seven bedrooms. Therefore, it turns out that these landlords rent the six or seven rooms to students for 500 and 600 euro a month and in the house there are only two bathrooms for all. Even worse is that explorers do not even pass receipts and escape the tax authorities regarding the approximate income of 4200 euros per month, if it is a six -room residence. Exploration and deplorable opportunism is fundamentally due to the lack of affordable housing, with the aggravation of being the parents of students paying the use of these rooms. Where is institutional inspection? Of course we do not believe that it will not be possible to find out where these homes that explore the students exist. Only on a Lisbon avenue we were aware that there are more than 20 homes with students rented to students. This is a situation that the new government could consider creating a group, like ASAE, dedicated exclusively to the irregularities committed and the exploration of young people who need a bed and a table to be students in college. The housing problem is also the decrease in birth rates. Obviously young people are unable to unite, contract family and live to think that the future is a problem. If they stay in their parents' homes, how can they acquire or lease a house to live with their mate and children who may be born? Impossible. We wrote with knowledge of the cause because we kept a chat with a young student from the Faculty of Letters who told us that he lives in a room of a residence with six more habitatures, all rented by 600 euros. And he stressed that the landlord reported that if he intended receipt Pecúlio to pay would have to be 750 euros. Deplorable. Another serious problem that is registered in cities such as Lisbon, Porto, Coimbra, Braga and Évora, among others, is the situation of women who are hired by employment agencies in order to be elderly people with reduced mobility or various types of dementia. These women, namely Portuguese, Brazilian and African, receive a salary when they receive less than half of what the contractor pays to these employment agencies. It is usually the children of these seniors and patients who pay, for example, 3000 euros per month and AMA workers receive the equivalent of the minimum wage. Many of them work on Saturdays and Sundays without being paid to double as the law requires. Sometimes they are women who live with family difficulties who have a job but will work on the weekend to raise some more money that helps in their survival. AMAs who have annual contract to work from Monday to Friday do not have any payment of Christmas allowance. Once again, we do not believe that the government is not aware of this reality and seeks to end with this kind of shameful exploitation. We all know how difficult it is to deal with day and night an elderly with dementia or that needs a wheelchair to move. These nominations still do extra jobs in the houses where they work, such as cooking, washing clothes and ironing, without any more remuneration. There are still cases where the elderly have pets and there are the exploited nominations that have to treat the animals and take them to the street. This type of exploitation, in our understanding, is just a new kind of slavery. This is what it is, with the rulers to whistle aside. Two relevant cases that would be deserving of a radical change so that the “Chicos-Parts” did not think that the world is those who exploit and enslave their fellow man.

item.title: The meteorological systems of early alert and their importance
item.description: (Continuation of the June 5th edition) Despite having an efficient meteorological service (administration of atmospheric, geophysical and astronomical services of the Philippines - Pagasa1) the Philippines, due to Haiyan, were the scene of one of the great tragedies related to tropical cyclones. In the case of Haiyan, the warning newsletters were issued, regularly and attentively, before and during the typhoon, but the fact that the flood risk maps were outdated made many people perished for taking refuge in shelters in areas considered safe in these maps. On the other hand, because there are many languages ​​in the country (over 180 languages ​​and regional dialects), bulletins are mainly issued in English and tagal, the two official languages. Thus, the reasons for such a large number of victims, besides the exceptional violence of the typhoon and flood risk maps were outdated, was the fact that the terms “Storm”, likely to be understood by much of the less educated population, were used. Among the recommendations expressed in the reports of the various missions in charge of evaluating the consequences of the typhoon excelled the need to urgently update the flood risk maps and the use in warning bulletins, less technical language in order to be easily understood by the populations. The Philippines, and some international media, reported that the president of the Guiuan2 municipality, the first Filipine city that was on the forecast of the typhoon, sent messengers with altifalantes, in motorcycles, to the various “Barangays” 3 of the municipality near the coast, warning the approach of a tsunami. The term "tsunami", although not technically correct in this situation, warned the populations, poorly sensitized by the forecast of a storm tide, to follow the instructions of the Civil Protection Authority in order to be evacuated, which was successfully achieved. It should be noted that people were well aware of the consequences of tsunamis, as news about the consequences of such a phenomenon that had occurred a few years earlier, in 2004, on the west of Sumatra, causing approximately 230,000 deadly victims in 14 different countries. The WMO and the United Nations Office to reduce the risk of disasters (UNDRR) 5 have insisted on the need to enlarge this type of early alert systems to other phenomena, in addition to those related to meteorology. Thus, the concept of early warning systems of multiple risks (internationally known as “Multihard Early Warning Systems”-Mhews), which cover various types of risks, considering interrelationships between them. The main risks that may be a reason for issuing multirriscos are essentially flooding, extractic cyclones, tropical cyclones (cyclones, typhoons, hurricanes), storm tides, droughts, forest fires, heat waves, landslides, seismos and tsunamis. According to the report “Global Status of Multi-Hazard Early Warning Systems 2024”, prepared by OMM and UNDRR (presented at COP29 by the United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres), countries with less developed systems have a mortality rate related to natural disasters of nearly six times higher than countries in which multirristers are most Advanced, and almost four times more people affected by catastrophes. It is expected that in the next conference on the climate, to be held under the auspices of UNFCCC6 (COP30-November 15-21, 2025, in Belém, Brazil), measures to improve early warning systems in countries where they are not properly implemented. References: Pagasa - Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration. Guiuan - Important city in the history of the Philippines. It is reported that, in the 16th century, it was on the Homonhon Island, belonging to that municipality, that Fernão de Magalhães landed for the first time in that archipelago. Perhaps for this reason the population of the city is mostly Catholic. Barangay - Administrative division in the Philippines, corresponding to the village. “Escap/Wmo Typhoon Committee” - has been headquartered by the Secretariat in Macao since 2007. UNDRR - United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction. UNFCCC - United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.

item.title: The meteorological systems of early alert and their importance
item.description: Olavo Rasquinho * General knowledge is the importance that weather warnings have for human activities. However, about a third of the 193 members of the World Meteorological Organization (MMO) do not yet have efficient early warning systems to warn populations to be careful against the loss of lives and goods before natural meteorological disasters. In the face of this reality, OMM selected for the theme of the 2025 World Meteorological Day celebrations (DMM) “Closing the Early Warning Gap Together”, which can be translated by “We reduce the failures of early alert systems together”. The theme is part of the “Early Warly Warnings for All Initiative”), which aims to protect the global scale, relative to hazardous hydrometeorological, climate and related environmental events. Early alert systems are essentially based on four components: knowledge of risk; Monitoring and forecasting; communication and dissemination of alerts and response capacity of the communities. The failure of any of these components compromises the effectiveness of measures to be taken to prevent a natural disaster from becoming a catastrophe. Meteorological services, using means of a global observation network, and physical-mathematical models that simulate the behavior of the atmosphere, predict the occurrence of phenomena that may affect the lives of citizens. For example, the approximate time of the arrival of a typhoon the earth may be foreseen, but the simple fact that your movement slows or accelerates may result in not getting it right when it happens. Usually the typhoons, which always form at sea, decrease the speed of progression and intensity as they approach land. However, sporadically, this may not happen. This is what happened with Typhoon Hato who, in August 2017, hit Macao with serious consequences. Instead of decreasing its displacement speed and weakening, it suffered sudden intensification and increased speed, surprising meteorologists. This happened with the aggravation of the arrival of the typhoon coincided with the high astronomical tide, which reinforced the consequences of the storm tide. It can then be deduced that the “monitoring and prediction” component and, consequently, the component “communication and spread of alerts” of the early alert system did not function a hundred percent due to the anommal behavior of the typhoon. This happened on a territory where the early alert system is well structured and usually works with a high success rate. Imagine what may happen when this type of phenomena occurs in regions where there are no early warning systems or, therefore, are not effective enough due to deficiency in means or lack of human resources. As an example of this situation one can mention what happened in November 1970, in the so-called East Pakistan. This Pakistani province was hit by one of the most violent cyclones of the last century, the “Great Bhola Cyclone”, which caused a number of dead that is estimated between three hundred thousand at half a million. It is considered the tropical cyclone that has caused the most victims since there are records. Winds of about 200 km/h, coincident with a high astronomical tide, dragged the waters of the Indian Earth-to-Dentro, invading much of the Ganges River delta, causing a large storm tide that reached 6 meters. The consequences were so serious that they contributed to the people's revolt, motivated by the weak response of the central government. The discontent generated contributed to intensify the struggle for the independence of the province, which was materialized in 1971, giving rise to a new country, Bangladeche. Another example was what happened in Myanmar (former Burma) in May 2008. This country, directed for tens of years by military dictatorships, would not suffer so much the consequences of the Camis Cyclone if they were attached with a modern and efficient alert system. The more than 130,000 deadly victims caused by the storm tide associated with the tropical cyclone would certainly be largely avoided. A few days before the cyclone hit that country had already been issued by the Specialized Regional Meteorological Center (“Regional Specialized Meteorological Center - RSMC”), which is the center responsible for the Meteorological Surveillance for the Indian Norte Basin1. Also the Meteorological Service of India warned the government of Myanmar about the high probability of occurring a large storm tide that would affect the Irauádi River Delta, which happened about 48 hours later, enough time to evacuate the populations. In the case of Bhola and Nargis cyclones the alert systems were practically nonexistent in East Pakistan and Myanmar. However, in the Philippines, an average affected country, on average, by about twenty tropical storms and typhoons, although the meteorological and civil protection authorities were considered well organized, there were failures in two of the components of the early alert system in November 2013. The components “Knowledge of Risk” and “Communication and Dissemination of Alerts” failed partly due to outdated flood risk maps and inadequate language used. Typhoon Haiyan (designated in the Philippines by Yolanda Superirty) caused a number of deadly victims of more than six thousand. The main reasons for the catastrophe to have reached such proportions were, in addition to the failures of two of the components of the early alert system, in the facts that the pressure was extremely low in the center (about 895 HPa), winds of great intensity and the typhoon had entered the land near the tide tide tide. These conjugated factors caused a storm tide that reached, in some places between 6 and 7 meters. Note that the decrease in pressure of 1 hPa corresponds to the elevation of the sea level of about 1 cm. item.title: The Star Door (I)
item.description: “One must have chaos withself to Give Birth to a Dancing Star” Friedrich Nietzsche The project centered on artificial intelligence (AI) announced by Trump redefines the silicon valley hierarchies. And clarifies the industrial nature of AI. Since winning the elections, Donald Trump has spent a long time to talk about the stars. In the beginning was Musk, the famous «Nascent Astro», on the occasion of the first speech of the tycoon after the electoral victory. Subsequently, still linked to Elon, it was the turn of Mars, the red star and where to plant the star flag to update the manifest fate of such an exceptional people that it must become transglobal. And then, like a blue sky radius, the time has come for Stargate, the "door of the stars" with which Trump intends to relaunch the American dream, linking it to technological innovation and AI development, with the concrete objective of preserving world leadership. The United States must maintain technological superiority from China that recently developed an AI (Deepseek) model capable of achieving chatgpt results with lower level hardware (according to them) and lower costs because only then Washington can establish with Beijing a "agreement" which is Trump's new word from a force position. Stargate is a potentially revolutionary project. It is about investing a hundred billion dollars immediately, intended to quintuple, to accelerate the development of the new generation of artificial intelligences, integrating the material production chain (data centers and chips) with the intangible (cloud computer management and algorithm writing). To do so, Trump trusts those elements of the technological world that, until yesterday, were far from the spotlight. And sanction the end of those who, within the state, were occupied exactly with these issues. In short, the “Paypal Mafia” in its thielist and muskian currents will be out of the star door, occupying the antechamber in the company of Eric Schmidt, a former Google Democrat who presides over the (expensive) national security committee, now totally empty meaning. Trump's decision is clear. Like a new Adam Smith, the tycoon proposes a division of labor necessary so that none of the great men in the technological sector can accumulate too much power. There are no stars so brilliant that they can overshadow that of the president, which applies the most classic of divide et reepe. Will it work? To understand, we have to cross the door of the stars. When, last January 21, Trump appeared at the White House to announce the launch of Stargate, there were three people with him. Less known than Elon Musk, often in disagreement with Tesla's founder and eager for showing the world as they can also be useful to the tycoon. After the president, the first to speak was Larry Ellison, co-founder and executive president of Oracle. Your company works with cloud, that is, it stores huge amounts of data for various technological companies. The eighty -year -old entrepreneur, against the president of his age, explains how AI can be useful for health. Your speech looks like an advertising announcement. But beware of appearances. Ellison theorizes the use of AI to implement a total surveillance system, necessary for "citizens to behave correctly." The president of Oracle is the only one who has not formally a role in organizing Stargate, but Trump introduced him as "CEO of everything" and also made it clear that he would be happy if they bought Tiktok. Trump and Ellison are from the same generation, both are New Yorkers and have known each other for a long time. Probably understand each other very well. Then I intervened Masayoshi Son, known as Masa. He is the founder, representative director, corporate executive, chairman of the board and CEO of Softbank Group (SBG), a Japanese group of risk capital, and will be the financial responsible of Stargate. The task of bringing the capitalization of the star door to five hundred billion of dollars is, first of all, yours. But above all, as a good Japanese, Masa knows that the project was born with an antichinese function that "this is not just a business", making a point of specifying. It is about developing AI so as not to lose the race for innovation with China. And perhaps also create a container to promote the development of ARM, the English company that sells AI chips and that appears as the flagship of Softbank's investments. Last but not least, Sam Altman. In November 2023, after the case that shook OpenAi's foundations due to its dismissal (later withdrawal), the state entered its company. Informally. But the presence of a figure like Larry Summers, a former treasure secretary and very close to national security devices on the ChatgPT mother's council council clearly shows how the government wanted to be aware of its internal dynamics. Today, just over a year later, it is Altman who binds to the state. The founder of OpenAi will in fact play Stargate's role of operational responsible. And it has already obtained an important result, since Microsoft to which OpenAI is linked by a contract by 2030 granted Altman's company the ability to also use its competitors' cloud services for this project. In particular, obviously, those of Larry Ellison, CEO of everything. The main actors are joined by Microsoft itself that will provide its stargate cloud platform and obviously NVIDIA. Because there is no GPU (Graphic Processing Units) to train the Machine Learning models. Jensen Huang's Nvidia is still, in fact, practically monopolistic in the sector, although the market is expanding and is increasingly difficult to meet demand. Finally, the United Arab Emirates Fund (MGX) specializing in technological investments will collaborate in the financial management of the operation. And so, almost as in a joke, Stargate is, in the end, a container in which a Bronx -born octogenarian, a sixty -year -old Japanese, a young AI guru, Microsoft, Jensen Huang with his leather coat and an Abu Dhabi background. Trump's task will be to coordinate this heterogeneous human mass, joining it around a strategic goal of developing AI to reprogram the American dream and keep China a safe distance. All clear. How to proceed? (Continues)

item.title: Creative Macau | New Miguel Quental exhibition with images of Goa
item.description:
After the first photography exhibition at the University of Macau, Miguel Quental again shows images of his own, but this time about Goa. The show is welcomed from Saturday at Creative Macau and intends to show the public the “rich inheritance of vibrant color” of a territory that once was the “capital of an empire”
Creative Macau hosts, from Saturday, a new exhibition by Miguel Quental, better known for his work in law, but this time presents his images taken in Goa. “Colors of Goa” is the name of the exhibition that opens from 6.30 pm on Saturday, presenting images of what was “capital of an empire”, from which “a rich inheritance of vibrant colors, aromas, flavors, images and beliefs that transcend our imagination”, describes the author of the photos, quoted by a Creative Macau statement. “In search of this legacy, I left for Goa, but the experience went far beyond what I could expect. Its ancient churches and other places of worship exhibit a captivating beauty, offering a unique and transcendent peace that goes beyond the spirituality to which they are dedicated. The manorial houses, full of history, details and emotion, resemble noble, majestic and impassible, full of art and memories.” It also describes. Miguel Quental does not forget either “the alleys of Velha Goa, Pangim, Margão and the Fontaínhas neighborhood, which breathe and offer us a vibrant and almost magnetic heritage that touches the soul and invites us to go beyond the historical and cultural memories that memory does not allow us to forget”. "In this spirit, I share some of the many images I took there, but I'm aware that much more to find out," says the author, who hopes that she will "invite her to visit her soon." I like the image Residing in Macao since 2002, Miguel Quental has been in the third individual exhibition. The last one was at the University of Macao in November last year, being a photographic project that was born from an exchange trip from the Center for Legal and Judicial Studies of the University of Macao to Angola and Mozambique. In addition to participating in the visit as a teacher, Miguel Quental photographed the daily lives of the populations of these countries. "As I like to do photography I was taking some images during these trips. This is a center that is dedicated to the comparative study of law and the publications that are made in Portuguese in its relationship with China, and I thought it was interesting to make known the culture and way of living from Angola and Mozambique to college students who never had access to this reality," he explained to HM at the time.

item.title: Camões was Mozambique's “great‘ amateur ”, influencing his poetry
item.description: The academic Lourenço do Rosario highlighted on Friday that Luís de Camões influenced Mozambican poets as a "great" amateur ", asking for more research to discover a camões hosted on the island of Mozambique, in the north of the country. "Camões was a great amateur, was very fond of women and one of the reasons that he was always in prison was exactly because he had several problems with women, especially married (…). He arrives in 1567, had no money to continue the trip to Portugal, had no money to live on the island of Mozambique," said the academic Mozambican Lourenço do Rosário, after the opening of the second congress. 500 years of Camões. Mozambique welcomes the second 500th anniversary Congress of the birth of Luís de Camões, emphasizing the relationship of the Portuguese poet with the Indian Ocean and the Mozambican territory. Lourenço do Rosário, essayist and professor of literature, said Camões was welcomed “in Macúti”, houses built with local material, “by Mutian women” (woman, in the local language of Nampula), when he arrived at Mozambique Island. "He makes that poem‛ Endchas to Barbara Slave, "which is one of the most beautiful poems he wrote about women, so Camões knew how to sing the woman," added Lourenço do Rosário. "An obligation" The former dean of the Polytechnic University of Maputo and also a member of Leya Award criticized Portugal for not valuing the deeds of Camões for the Portuguese East Empire, arguing that one cannot “alienate this reality” that the poet “began to write and ended his works in Mozambique”. "So, we have this obligation to rescue this reading of Camões and go see what he had critic had about Portugal's presence in the East Empire," said the teacher, asking for research to ensure the presence of Camões in schools from his action in the East. From this perspective, Lourenço do Rosário also recalled that Camões should be seen in Mozambique as someone who was “arrested, expelled and degraded”, who fought as a military and lived poor, having undergone “deprivation” in the East before Portugal introduced him to the world as a “great Portuguese poet”. Lourenço do Rosário has asked more research to influence political decisions in the face of Camões in education programs in the country. "It is necessary to value what is ours, and Camões is ours, because he wrote here." “There is a whole generation, a group of [Eduardo] White, Nelson Health, Rui Knopfli, especially the poets that are linked to the island of Mozambique, have a lot of influence from Camões writing, the look of Camões on the world, not only from the point of view of love, but also about social criticism, so I think Mozambican researchers have a lot of material to discover and influence our schools. But Camões ours, from Mozambique, ”he said. The Portuguese Ambassador in Mozambique, also present at the opening of Congress, highlighted the academic movement in the praise of Camões as a “unifying element” of a culture and language that “is not only of the Portuguese”, pointing to the poet as a “symbol of projection of the Portuguese speaker community”. The Camões in Africa and Asia Network, which promotes and encourages studies and publications about Camões, held the first Congress about the 500th anniversary of the poet's birth last year, in Macao, and for 2026, the same event is intended to go to Goa, making a tour of places where it passed and lived, explained the organization. Born 501 years ago, on June 10, 1524, in Lisbon, the Soldado Poet Luís Vaz de Camões lived and wrote about two years on the island of Mozambique, in the old street of Fogo, where it will also make sense that love “is fire that burns without seeing”.

item.title: Alliance Française | Presented today documentary about Maria Callas
item.description:
It is today that the public can remember one of the great voices of our time, Maria Callas, and also know more about your life. This is because the Alliance Française de Macau hosts the exhibition of the documentary “Callas - Paris, 1958”, by French director Tom Volf. The exhibition takes place in the context of the French May festival, in partnership with Hong Kong
The Alliance Française de Macau, in collaboration with the Alliance Française de Hong Kong and French May Arts Fest, today in Macau the documentary film “Callas-Paris, 1958”, by Tom Volf, dating from 2023. The exhibition takes place from 7:30 pm in Studio City's room 4, integrating in the “French May Cinema Program” section ”section” section French May festival. According to a press release of the organization, "the exhibition will be preceded by a presentation by Michel Reis, Melómane, author and host of Radio Macau's Classical Music Program," Scherzo ", and Peter Gordon, who has lived in Hong Kong since 1985 and works with the main opera companies of Hong Kong and Guangdong." The film documents the premiere of “one of the greatest legends of opera, the quintessential diva, media sensation and face of twentieth -century opera, the extremely rare soprano 'plague'” Maria Callas in France. This was the concert in which Maria Callas was accompanied by the Orchestre de L'Epéra Nationale de Paris and Choeurs, under the direction of conductor Georges Sébastian, "a show that became a real legend." It was, according to the same note, a show that integrated a gala of charity in favor of the works of “Légion d'Honneur”, being broadcast live on French television and televisions from other European countries through Eurovision, which was quite rare at the time. Announced by the press as "Le Plus Grand Spectacle du Monde" [the largest show in the world], "The concert was really exceptional." Celebration order The film was commissioned by Fondação Callas, through the Maria Callas Donations Fund, created by Volf himself, for the celebration of the centenary of the birth of the celebrated Greco American sopranic, which was marked on December 2, 2023. The foundation was created in Paris in 2017 by the world-known conductor Georges Prêtre, who developed a very close working relationship with the singer, who directed several times. This documentary took six years to complete and two years to color. Volf was also the author of the critical documentary “Maria by Callas”, released in 2017 in more than 40 countries, which won awards at film festivals in Europe and the US. He also launched three books about the singer: “Maria by Callas”, “Callas Confidential” and “Maria Callas: Memoirs & Letters”. In the show chosen for this documentary, Maria Callas came up "with her most elegant sewing high couture clothing worth more than one million US dollars," the chosen repertoire "showed Callas at its heyday, both in recital and actress." “It is noteworthy that he had sung 'Violetta' in a production of 'La Traviata' in Lisbon at the beginning of this year of 1958, at the famous São Carlos National Theater, considered his best Violetta of the more than 60 he played,” he reads. Comments by famous actor and animator Pierre Tchernia, known as “Magic Tchernia”, were complemented by Pierre Dumayet during the intervals, both behind the scenes during the scenario changes, which conducted numerous interviews with figures such as Jean Cocteau, Patachou, Brigitte Bardot, Gilbert Bécaud, Zizi, Zizi Jeanmaire and Roland Petit, as well as Beguum Aga Khan, a program run by Roger Benarm entitled “La Grande Nuit de L'Opéra” [The Great Night of the Opera], under the tutelage of the Institut National de L'Audiovisuel (Ina). The original filming of the concert were restored to the modern large screens by producer and a specialist in coloring and restoration of files and archive images, Samuel François-Steininger, from original 16mm coils, which, along with the matrix ribbons, were recently discovered in the Calla recordings file itself. The documentary aired Friday was produced in French with English subtitles and "shows the iconic opera singer at the height of her fame, preserving her voice in all her colors and amplitude for posterity." “In the performance, visual elements are as important as the vocal dimensions in their art. Present in color, 4K resolution and surround dolby atmos, Tom Volf's meticulous work provided the public with a modern immersion in this historical action,” reads the same note.

item.title: Exhibition | Local artist Cheong Kin Man presents new show in Lisbon
item.description: It is a creative path with several locations that Cheong Kin Man and Marta Sala perform in Lisbon from tomorrow: first, the show “The Slazing and Curious Travel”, to see at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center until July 6, whose launch is preceded by a conversation with artists and a book release. Then, on Friday, there is another debate at the Goethe Institute Image of: Guillaume-Galante For several years based in Berlin, Cheong Kin Man has been a visual artist and anthropologist who has never left experimentation aside. Now, alongside the Polish artist Marta Sala, has been embedded in new artistic directions, which, this time, flow into Lisbon. This happens in multiple forms. First with the show “The Slazing and Curious Travel”, which will be evident at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) between tomorrow and July 6. Curated by Lorena Tabares Salamanca, from Colombia, the show is a “cross -cultural exposure that crosses art, visual anthropology and personal archives, reflecting on displacements, memory and languages”, with the signature of Cheong Kin Man, Marta Sale and Deborah Uhde from Germany. The public can see “immersive installations, textile pieces, video and self-ethnographs that reconfigure the relations between travel, history and knowledge,” says a press release of the Poland City Council. In the inaugural session of this Thursday there will also be a conversation with the artists, which is repeated on Friday, but this time at the Goethe Institute library in Lisbon at 18h. Here, in “Creating Connections”, a conversation with the three artists of “The Slazing and Curious Travel”, which is “an intimate artistic meeting, in which Deborah Uhde, as well as the duo Marta Stanisława Sala and Cheong Kin Man, will share among themselves-and with the public-reflections on their practices and experiences in creating intercultural bonds through art, especially art, with emphasis on art. their paths in Berlin and the latest artist books. ” These initiatives are supported by the Poland Embassy in Portugal, the Ministry of Culture and National Heritage and the Adam Mickiewicz Institute of Poland. They also have the partnership of the City Council of Krakow and the Boym Institute, also from Poland. Fusions and Travel The show that now presents at CCCM brings works of the duo Cheong Kin Man - Marta Sala, known “by the fusion of fabric, video and language experiments”, in which the public can “embark on a trip through parallel worlds and personal files” based on three multimedia projects, such as “The Utopian's compass”, “Revelations” and a new cycle of Macaense diaspora. In the case of “The Utopia Compass”, it is a “bamboo and fabric installation composed of 13 textile compositions that materialize processes of cultural discovery and mutual learning”, and the work is inspired by the “Flora Sinensis” (1656), by the Jesuit Miguel Boym, who studied in Krakow; as well as “in the musicality of Cantonense poetry translated into chromatic shapes and in self-ethrical motifs associated with the migration of a Macaense family and the contemporary trips of the artists”. In turn, the “Revelation” series, presented for the first time at the Macao Biennial in 2023, “combines text, textiles and video in a science fiction narrative”, and the fabric “which integrates this fiction coding episodes of the Polish family archive, including migration through the borders of the twentieth century - from Vilnius to the Mongolian steppes and, later, to current Poland”. Also noteworthy is that the exhibition reveals “the experimental film project based on interviews within the Macaense Diaspora”, taking the public to Brazil, “where the nostalgia shared by humanity echoes in automatic translations for various languages”. There are also, associated with the video, the new publication entitled “Entrevista, MięDzy-Wizje. Roz-Mowa, disorder”, which is “in the form of Flipbook with Luso-Polaco glossary, which deconstructs an excerpt from the recording to reflect on each word said and the limits and possibilities of translation”. This Thursday's CCCM session begins with a guided tour of the artists at 5 pm, including the launch of "Revelation", a new book by artists. In the case of Deborah Uhde, who accompanies the pair of artists from Macao and Poland, is a filmmaker and artist graduated in beautiful art and humanities, residing in Berlin. Obtained his diploma at the Art University of Braunschweig (2009–2015). It has a formation in Philosophy, History of Art and Journalism from the University of Leipzig (2006–2009). Deborah's work was recognized with several bags and awards. New book The duo Kin Man - Sala brings to Lisbon the new edition of the book "Revelations", which includes "a collection of fictional ideograms originally created at the house of Krakow in Nuremberg, the only cultural institution in the municipality of Krakow outside Poland." This reprint now has over 600 pages and was supported by the Oriente Foundation. The artist book was originally commissioned for the Macau Biennial in 2023, containing “hundreds of ideograms originating from the Copenhagen with Love Exhibition,” held in Nuremberg in 2024, with the support of the East Foundation and the Municipal Chambers of Krakow and Nuremberg.

item.title: Borders | Number of entries and exits exceeded 100 million
item.description: From the beginning of the year until 2 pm on Saturday, authorities have accounted for 100 million entrances and exits at the Macao borders. According to data revealed yesterday by the Public Security Police Corps, the bar of 100 million border movements occurred 18 days earlier than last year. Authorities add that it was "beaten again a shorter record of short time to reach one hundred million border passages, with a daily average of 0.6 million inputs and exits of Macao, representing an increase of 10.8 percent over the same period last year." CPSP also points out that the volume of passengers/tickets at the Cerco doors border post exceeded 50 million on May 30, and that the Hungqin and Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Posts and Ponte reached the “annual flow of 10 million border passages, successively on May 7 and 9, earlier than the previous year”. The 100 million entrances and exits, about 36.2 million were residents of Macao, while the border movements of visitors reached almost 34 million. From the beginning of the year, until last Saturday, 25.9 million non-resident and family workers have entered and left Macao. The CPSP explains the increase in the flow of people on the borders this year with the "impulse of policies favorable to Macao as" one entry a week ", a visa of multiple entries' and 'circulation of Macao vehicles in Guangdong province'.

item.title: Facilitated entry to foreigners through the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge
item.description: The Public Security Police body announced that tourists from 82 countries, including Portugal, Brazil and Cape Verde, will be able to enter the region through the largest sea bridge in the world, without having to leave the vehicle. The measure comes into force today on the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau bridge and covers all visitors from the 82 entry-expected countries, CPSP said. In a statement issued on Thursday, police said that all foreign tourists “armed with a valid passport”, regardless of nationality, will be able to leave Macao and enter the bridge without leaving the vehicle. The goal of the police is to "promote international cultural exchange and help Macau become an open platform abroad (…) and an important window for the exchange between Chinese and Western civilizations." Police added that the measure, which covers vehicles that can transport up to nine people, was decided “after an in -depth evaluation of the demand for entry and exit” at the Bridge Border post. To the other bank The Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge, the world's longest maritime crossing, registered more than 172,000 foreign passengers by the end of April, an increase of 70 percent compared to the same period of 2024. “This increase is largely due to the expansion of visa exemption policies by China, and Zhuhai's terrestrial border post is the only one in continental territory Chinese that offers direct road access to Hong Kong International Airport, ”Chinese state news agency Xinhua said. At the end of April, the Secretary for Macao Security announced plans to accelerate the border control of foreign visitors, without resident status or work authorization, through the use of automatic electronic channels. Authorities will expand self-service equipment to the biometric data collection system, which will apply to all foreign visitors, explained Wong Sio Chak. The secretary added that the government will study the extension of iris recognition technology in non -resident border controls in 2025.

item.title: Dsal | 96 illegal employees in G-Dragon concert
item.description:
On Saturday, police and work services did an operation at the Korean singer G-Dragon merchandising stalls at the Galaxy Arena, where 96 possibly in illegal staff were found. Two officials of the organization were taken to the squadron for investigation
The past weekend was of great euphoria at Cotai, with three concerts by popular Korean singer G-Dragon in the Galaxy Arena. However, on Saturday morning a joint operation of the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) and the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL) detected 96 employees suspected of being in an illegal situation in the merchandising selling zone. Subsequently, the CPSP issued a statement confirmed during the process of verifying the identity of the workers the presence of 96 non-resident workers, whose authorization to work would have to be confirmed with DSAL. Following the discovery, two officials of the concert organization were taken to the police squad for investigation. The authorities did not add more information about the case, in addition to the admission of CPSP that would be investigating the situation and that were found infringements, the case will be treated according to the law. Until the closing of this edition, DSAL had not been pronounced on the occurrence, nor the company that organized the concerts, Tencent Music Entertainment Live. The situation generated controversy and many publications on social networks. One of the most discussed theories pointed to a possible revenge of clandestine ticket sellers, who would have been expelled from the enclosure on Friday, which will allegedly warned the authorities for the illegal situation of the employees. NETWORK TRAINS In addition to revenge theory, images of publications were also shared to recruit part -time workers during concerts, especially on Chinese social networks. In one of the publications, the organizer sought to recruit women under 30, referring as a daily remuneration 200 Renminbis, as well as an additional bonus in accordance with sales. The announcement also indicated that the employer was willing to offer accommodation to employees who needed it. Also at the level of the legitimate sale of tickets for the Korean star concert there was confusion. In Hong Kong, the cityline ticket sales platform has been complained due to the printing of the wrong date, number of wrong tickets and the passivity of employees in resolving and treatment of complaints.

item.title: DSAMA | They start maritime tours of the weekend
item.description: The “Maritime Ride in the 2025 Fishing Defense period”, organized by the Macao Fisherman's Mutual Assistance Association, was officially inaugurated on Saturday. Until July 20, three daily sea trips will be operated on Saturdays and Sundays, between the Green Island Dock and the waters near Shizimen. The trips, which last about an hour and a half, have matches at 10:30, 14:30 and 4:30 pm. Tours cost 40 patacas per person and are limited to a maximum of 26 passengers, and each person can only buy a maximum of four tickets. The vessel used on the tours is a traditional wooden fishing boat about 31 meters. In a statement issued on Saturday, the Directorate of Maritime and Water Affairs Services (DSAMA) states that the “itinerary allows the public to enjoy the landscape of the inner port, bridges and the modernization of the Shizimen commercial zone”. On board the vessel are displayed devices and fishing equipment, as well as boat models. During the trip, fishermen will demonstrate traditional techniques of weaving and sharing personal stories about the profession. The tours are supported by Dsama and Galaxy, Melco, MGM and SJM dealers.

item.title: Cultural Week | Government wants to change events to Zhongshan
item.description:
The executive intends that the 17th edition of the China Cultural Week and Portuguese-speaking countries will be fully held in Zhongshan, but the Lusophone associations involved in the event are against the change of the event's nevral center, despite supporting the expansion to the great bay.
The government intends that the 17th edition of the China Cultural Week and Portuguese -speaking countries will be fully held in Zhongshan, Canton province, despite being locally funded. Information about the Institute's plan for the promotion of commerce and investment of Macau (Ipim) was advanced by the platform newspaper in the Friday issue, but has the opposition of local associations. According to the publication, IPIM maintained separated meetings with the Lusophone Associations involved in the event and told them that at least this year, the event will leave Macau to move inside. After the meetings, the associations have joined to refuse that the event be taken entirely to Zhongshan, although they agree that the interior penetration is positive for all parts. According to the letter sent to the IPIM, Lusophone associations argue “the importance of preserving the event in the MSAR, maintaining it as the nerve center of this cultural celebration”. “Macao has been, throughout history, the bridge between Lusophone and Chinese cultures, and we believe this character must remain,” he was added. To the platform, the Macao Forum did not deny the intention to hold the entire event in Zhongshan, and assumed that it aims to “ensure the success of the event, both in Macau and the Great Bay, for all parties involved, as well as for participants and the public”. The Macao Forum also indicated that it is acting "in accordance with the decision taken by all parties participating in the Macao Forum, at the 20th Ordinary Meeting of the Permanent Secretariat, to include Elements of the Cultural Week in the Great Bay." Still, the body has pointed out that "it is collaborating with all its partners, whether government or civil society, including the associations of Portuguese -speaking countries in Macau, with a view to welcoming and integrating all the ideas, concerns and contributions it has received and continues to receive." "Wrapping paper" In addition to the trip to Zhongshan, the associations complain about the new role they are taking into the event, since the integration of the Macao Forum in IPIM, which made them lose functional autonomy. In addition to this aspect, the platform, the cultural week of China and Portuguese -speaking countries has been awarded to a company, which deals with all the details of the event, on the fringes of associations, who is responsible for the role of just indicating the names to be invited. This new reality led to a source of associations, which refused to be identified, to collapse to the newspaper that associations only feel as “package papers” to legitimize the event. Among the complaints against the new role is the fact that associations currently do not even have a maneuver room to receive or socialize with the artists or economic agents invited to the event of these countries. Given this reality, associations suggest the “limitation of the intervention of companies that do not know the cultural concept developed over the years” to ensure “loyalty to the original values ​​of the event”.

item.title: Housing | Market shrinks more than 50% in a year
item.description:
The housing market continues in contraction and within one year the average price of the square meter devalued 23.8 percent. If the comparison is made with the pre-pound period, prices fell 39.5 percent
In early May, the number of transactions in the housing market dropped to less than half, with a 57.6 percent reduction compared to the first half of May last year. The information is contained in the Statistics of the Directorate of Finance Services (DSF). According to the most recent data, in the first half of May this year there was a total of 78 purchases and housing sales, which contrasts with the 184 transactions recorded in the first fifteen days of May 2024. This is a difference of 106 businesses. Changes within one year did not become the number of transactions, the same happened with the average price of the square meter. In the first half of May this year the average housing price was 69,634 patacas per square meter, which means a 23.8 percent reduction compared to the same period, when the average price was 91,361 patacas per square meter. The reduction means that if a person paid, last year, 5.80 million patacas for a housing, the same house would be worth 4.42 million patacas, which implies a devaluation of 1.38 million patacas. In early May this year, Coloane was the region with the most expensive houses, where the average price was 90,755 patacas per square meter. Instead, on the Macao peninsula the average price per square meter was 69,132 patacas per square meter, the smallest. Other realities If the comparison is made with the first half of April this year, the reduction at both the number of transactions and the price is more moderate. In terms of housing price, within one month the reduction was 11 percent, given that at the beginning of April this year the average price of the square meter was set at 78,204 patacas. When analyzing the tendency to the number of transactions, the reduction was 34.6 percent, greater than one third, since in early April had been registered with the DSF a total of 133 transactions. The latest number of transactions was only 78 purchases and sales, which means a difference of 55 transactions. Comparisons with the pre-pound period show an even more pronounced contrast. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. item.title: Myanmar | XI expresses the desire to “accelerate cooperation”
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping yesterday sent a message to Myanmar Military Junta Chief, Min Aung Hlaing, expressing the willingness to “accelerate high quality cooperation” between China and ancient Burma. Xi stressed that the friendship between China and Myanmar “resisted the test of time and was reinforced,” according to a statement issued by the 75th anniversary of the establishment of bilateral diplomatic relations, quoted by the Chinese official news agency Xinhua. "The two countries have maintained a good neighborhood, deepened mutually beneficial cooperation and firmly leaned on issues related to their fundamental interests and essential concerns, thus giving an excellent example of friendly exchange between nations," said the Chinese head of state. China attributes “great importance” to the development of ties with Myanmar and is willing to work with the country, using the 75th anniversary of diplomatic ties “as an opportunity to accelerate high quality cooperation within the track and route,” said Xi. The Chinese president met with Min Aung Hlaing on May 9 in Moscow, in terms of the first personal meeting between the two since the coup d'état was carried out by the Military Board on February 1, 2021, with the arrest of President-elect Win Myint, as well as the former government party leader, Aung Suu Kyi, and other rulers and politicians. Although diplomatic exchanges between Myanmar and China have not been interrupted by the coup, they have become more public over the years, such as Beijing's mediation in the conflict.

item.title: Hong Kong USA AI to predict Alzheimer's risks through retina images
item.description: A Hong Kong Health Center has developed a system that uses Artificial Intelligence Technologies (AI) to predict the risk of Alzheimer's disease through retinal image analysis, a pioneering advance in the world. The system is not invasively analyzes the bottom images of the eye, detecting early changes in blood vessels and retinal nerves that may be related to Alzheimer's disease, allowing to identify potential risk cases years before clinical symptoms appear. Humansa Medical Center, a longevity-centered health center, has developed the system in collaboration with I-Cognitio Sciences, an ophthalmological technology company at the Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK). The artificial intelligence of i-cognitio has been validated with a vast data set, which includes nearly 13,000 eye background images of 648 patients diagnosed with Alzheimer's and over 3,000 individuals with normal cognition. A study published in 2022 in Lancet Digital Health journal showed that artificial intelligence technology developed for detecting Alzheimer's risk reaches a precision of 80 percent to 92 percent in multiethnic populations from various countries. Dementia affects about one third of people over 85 in the Asia Pacific region, according to recent data. In Hong Kong, dementia affects 10 percent of the population over 70 years old and Alzheimer's disease is responsible for more than half of diagnosed cases. Scientific studies underline that up to 45 percent of dementia cases could be avoided or delayed through early interventions, stressing the importance of early detection to mitigate the impact of dementia on the population. However, conventional cognitive tests and brain structural imaging have limited accuracy, while advanced methods such as amyloid pet and cerebrospinal fluid analysis are invasive and less accessible to the general population. Crucial action In this context, this study has developed a model based on deep learning with an approach that promises to offer “a simple, low -cost and poorly laborious solution” to identify potential patients in community environments and provide adequate accuracy and sensitivity. In an effort to highlight AI relevance in the diagnosis and health care of the brain, Vincent Mok, director and founder of I-Cognitio, highlighted the fundamental role of the retina as a window to the brain. According to Mok, "through non -invasive eye photography, it is possible to identify changes in retinal blood vessels and retinal nerves linked to Alzheimer's disease." The expert explained that these changes in the retina may manifest themselves 10 to 15 years before Alzheimer's clinical symptoms are evident, which represents a crucial opportunity for early intervention.

item.title: Chinese vice-prime minister in London to discuss tariffs with the US
item.description: Chinese vice-master-master, he Lifeng, will lead the Chinese delegation in commercial negotiations with US representatives tomorrow in London, the China Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced Saturday. In a statement quoted by the Spanish Agency of Efe, the Chinese Foreign Ministry indicated that He Lifeng will visit the United Kingdom from June 8 to 13 “at the invitation of the British government” and take advantage of its stay in the country to attend the “United States and Commercial Consultation Mechanism”. He, very close to China President Xi Jinping, was in charge of leading the commercial negotiations held last month in Geneva with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, who ended with a tariff truce between the two powers. The announcement was made a day after US President Donald Trump anticipated that the meeting on tariffs between US and China commercial delegates, agreed on Thursday in a telephone call with Xi Jinping, will be held Monday in London. The conversation between the two leaders occurred after last week Trump accused China, without giving details of violating the bilateral tariff pause agreement reached in May after the meeting in Geneva. Beijing answered arguing that it was Washington who violated the deal by imposing new chip restrictions and the cancellation of visas for Chinese students announced the week before. Open war Both countries had started a tariff escalation the day after Trump's announcement in early April of their so -called “reciprocal” tariffs, imposing at least 10 percent on all products entering the United States, regardless of their origin. Chinese products were subject to a 34 percent surcharge, in addition to the 20 percent taxes under the fight against fentanyl trafficking, an opioce that is causing a severe health crisis in the United States, and the customs rights that existed before Donald Trump's reelection. Beijing retaliated with equivalent tariffs, which led to a Customs War with Washington, reaching 125 percent and 145 percent, respectively, about the products of each country, causing a strong slowdown between the two giants.

item.title: Hong Kong | Discarded tariff retaliation that compromises “successful DNA”
item.description:
John Lee defends the Statute of the Special Administrative Region as a Free Port and wants to diversify the territory market increasingly away from the United States
Hong Kong Chief Executive John Lee said the tensions between Beijing and Washington will not make the city adopt retaliation measures, which would compromise their “successful DNA” and free port zone status. In an interview with Hong Kong South China Morning Post, on the third anniversary of his administration, Lee said his government prepared "contingency plans for the worst scenarios." He also assured that he is trying to counteract the impact of customs customs imposed by US President Donald Trump, China, who also affect the Special Chinese administrative region, despite the regime "one country, two systems." Hong Kong leader reaffirmed that the metropolis will maintain its Porto Livre statute and excluded the possibility of retaliation against the US, even if relations between Beijing and Washington deteriorate. Lee has rejected that this attitude is “passive”, defending the strategy as a way of preserving Hong Kong's economic status. According to the Hong Kong Basic Law, the mini-consumption that governs the city, the region will maintain its role as customs territory independent of China and will not impose tariffs unless the law sets the opposite, consolidating the position of Porto Livre. By other waters Lee also stated that in the two years left of her term, the Hong Kong government will intensify market diversification measures for the benefit of local companies, reducing their exposure to the United States and encouraging expansion to "blue oceans" in high potential economic regions, such as Southeast Asian and Middle East. "With 180-190 global economies, opportunities are vast. We are talking about reorienting strategies, developing new abilities and forging strategic alliances," he said, stressing the need to consolidate Hong Kong's position as a world financial and commercial center in the face of geopolitical tensions. The United States is the second largest Hong Kong export market, with a volume of $ 37.9 billion in goods in 2024, led by equipment and telecommunications parts and followed by computers, precious stones, jewelry, semiconductors and valves and electronic tubes.

item.title: CITIGROUP | Fired 3,500 employees in China
item.description: The US bank citigrigoup fired about 3,500 technology division employees in mainland China, as part of a global cost reduction strategy and operational restructuring, Jornal Financial Times said yesterday. The cuts affect a division based in the cities of Shanghai and Dalian, responsible for the provision of computer services to Citigroup operations in more than 20 countries. According to the bank, some of the jobs will be relocated to other countries, "to be closer to the business and products they support," without, however, revealing numbers or concrete destinations. The financial institution also indicated that the process should be completed "at the beginning of the fourth quarter." "Although there is still work to do, many of our efforts have enabled the efficiency of our way of operating, our workforce and the global presence in infrastructure," said Marc Luet, Citi's head to Japan, North Asia and Australia, quoted by the Financial Times. The bank, which has been present in mainland China since 1902, has ensured that the decision will not have an impact on the banking operations of its Chinese subsidiary, headquartered in Shanghai, nor the Canton -based technology team that continues to provide services to mainland China and Hong Kong. Third largest United States Bank in terms of assets, Citigroup has sought to resolve persistent operational and profitability challenges through deep restructuring, which included the dismissal of thousands of workers and a simplification of the management structure. This cut represents one of the largest discharges recorded between foreign financial groups in China in recent years, and reflects a growing trend of frame reduction in the technological area.

item.title: Japan Sea | Seoul rescues four North Koreans on boat
item.description: South Korea announced yesterday that it rescued four North Koreans whose boat was allegedly drift in territorial waters in the Japan Sea. The South Korean navy “detected a small North Korean wooden boat about 100 kilometers from the coast of Goseong”, on the east coast of South Korea, a military spokesman said. According to South Korean news agency Yonhap, the rescued had apparently crossed the sea border accidentally and asked to be returned to North Korea. The four were delivered "to the competent [South Korean authorities]," the military said, adding that the incident happened in May. North Korean deserters are usually subject to interrogation by South Korean security services. "If they wish to return to North Korea, we will guarantee rapid and safe repatriation for humanitarian reasons," said South Korean Unification Ministry. Seul said he is still awaiting a Pyongyang response about two North Korean repatriation found in similar circumstances for three months in the Yellow Sea, located between China, North Korea and South Korea. item.title: Hong Kong | Appointed first foreign judge in one year
item.description: The Hong Kong Parliament approved the first appointment of a foreign judge to the Chinese semi -autonomous region of a one year after a series of layoffs. The Territory Legislative Council voted on Wednesday in favor of a government proposal to appoint William Young to Hong Kong's last court for a three-year term, which is expected to begin in June. Hong Kong's number two number two, chief secretary Eric Chan Kwok-Ki stressed to the deputies that the judge led a commission of inquiry into the March 2019 attack on two Mosques in Christchurs. In August 2020, a white supremacist was sentenced to perpetual penalty without right to parole - the first sentence of this type in New Zealand - for having killed 51 Muslims. The appointment of judges of other jurisdictions that share the system known as 'Common Law' inherited from the UK “contributed to the maintenance of a high level of confidence in the judicial system” of Hong Kong, defended Eric Chan. The chief secretary also said that the coming of foreign judges "demonstrates that the basic law [Hong Kong's" mini-constitution "guarantees the independent exercise of judicial power." Return to the World After reforming herself from the Supreme Court of New Zealand in 2022, William Young, 73, served as a judge in the seychelles higher courts, Samoa and the Fiji Islands. In July 2022, the New Zealand was appointed to the courts of the Dubai International Financial Center in the United Arab Emirates, but fired less than a month later. At the time, Young gave the risk of “adverse perceptions” after the Human Rights Defense Organization Amnesty International accused the country of appointing foreign judges to try to legitimize the political regime. Five non -permanent foreign judges (two from the United Kingdom and three from Australia) currently perform functions in the Hong Kong Superior Court, which also has Lusodescendent Roberto Ribeiro. item.title: Education | China asks the US not to politicize exchanges
item.description: China yesterday criticized the new restrictions imposed by US President Donald Trump at the entrance of foreign citizens, including those who affect Harvard University, and appealed to Washington to stop educational cooperation. "Educational cooperation between China and the US is mutually beneficial. China has always opposed politicization in this area," the Ministry of Foreign Ministry Lin Jian said yesterday at a press conference. Lin responded to Trump's signed order that suspends for six months the entry of new international students into Harvard on charges of “radicalism” and “worrying foreign connections” by the academic center. Beijing warned that this measure will “harm the US image and credibility” and has ensured that it will defend the legitimate rights of its students and academics abroad. Harvard, one of the world's most prestigious universities, currently welcomes 10,158 international students from 150 countries, including 2,126 from China, according to data on the 2024/2025 school year published on the institution's international office portal. The spokesman also reacted to the new ban on traveling to the United States for citizens from 12 countries, including Iran, Haiti, Equatorial Guinea, Somalia and Yemen, and the restrictions imposed on citizens of seven, such as Cuba and Venezuela. "Interpersonal exchanges are the fundamental basis for promoting understanding and cooperation between countries. We hope that all parties will create conducive conditions for this purpose rather than raising barriers," Lin said.

item.title: Taiwan | Beijing offers rewards for the capture of computer pirates
item.description: Canton's Chinese City Public Security Office will offer rewards to those who help capture more than 20 Taiwan individuals accused of conducting cybership against a Chinese technology company. This is the first time Chinese public security authorities have taken this measure to “combat Taiwan's separatist forces,” according to the Official Global Times. It is also “the first coordinated action to repression of criminal activities organized by the Taiwan information force, communications and electronics,” he added. According to the Global Times, these “20 suspects of Taiwan Island” were involved in cybercats against a local Chinese technology company and are linked to the Progressive Democratic Party (DPP) authorities, currently in power in Taiwan. "The cybership was directed and executed by the DPP information, communications and electronics command, which performs multiple illegal activities," said the Cantão Municipal Public Security Office, which issued search warrants for the 20 suspects. item.title: Filipe de Saavedra, Teacher: “A Camões Interpretative Center in Macau is missing”
item.description:
Professor at the University of Science and Technology of Macao and a scholar of the presence of Camões in Asia, Philip de Saavedra understands that Macau is missing an interpretative center about the poet's life and work. The academic spoke yesterday at the National Library in Lisbon, about the correspondence written by Luís de Camões in Asia
He participated yesterday at the “from Lisbon to Goa: What the Letters of Camões” participated. What path does the East arise portrayed in these letters, and who were directed? The letters Camões wrote from Asia are in the order of the dozens. There is in them scholarship, philosophy, and also a lot of humor, sarcasm, and satire of humanist nature. Some were written from Ternate, others from Malaca, Macau, probably others from Cambodia, to recipients in India and Portugal. With the exception of the letters of Goa, where the identification of the writing site is generally present, maping those that were written during the rest of it would be a complex task. They are only given as written in Asia. Can you give examples of written letters in this context? I mention here two of the first he sent to the kingdom. The epistle whose first line is “The Poet Simony speaking” was written in January 1554, when Camões has just arrived in Goa, destined for his pupil, D. António de Noronha. It is a very emotional letter, giving it the storm that had plagued the Armada in the Cape of Good Hope, "seeing the death of the before me." Camões survived this limit experience aboard the São Bento ship, the only one to arrive that year to Goa, and which was lost in the turn of the Christmas lands, dying in this second bid the Captain Fernão de Álvares Cabral, and many of those who traveled with him. In addition to the news of his salvation, the poet was equally eager to tell his friend the expedition of D. Afonso de Noronha to Malabar, in which he had taken part in the previous month. In Irenal pages, Camões vehemently condemns the massacre of the few native troops by the “thick armed” of the disproportionate vice-king army. In his radical compliment of peace, the poet calls "true remedy" to the early death that cure the war crazes of those who want to live "by knights", for "who will walk by following the fero Mars always brings their eyes to their danger." Cruelly prophetic words: by irony of fate, at the moment the poet wrote these lines and sent them, that recipient diletus, for whose life he feared, already lay, lying during a military foray in Ceuta on April 29, 1553, only 17 years old. And the second letter? A year later, in January 1555, he wrote to a friend a different epistle in tone and in purpose, whose first line is "I wished so much", where he evoked the shock he suffered from the death of D. António, gathering a sonnet that had composed to his memory. It is clear that Camões also had great intimacy with this correspondent, who knew D. The presence of Camões in Macau is still wrapped in a certain myth. What are the concrete tests of your presence in the territory? It is necessary to separate the waters. The landing of Camões in Patane's busty, then called “cave”, is surrounded by a beautiful legendary aura. But the presence of Camões in Macao, this is not involved in "myth", is a factual and historical reality, founded on a wide variety of testimonies, all independent of each other. Insisting on a chronology that contained in the sources, but which was flagrantly erroneous, it was deliberately sought to confuse the doubts that could have about his permanence in the sinned, although unjustified, with false doubts about the poet's stay in Macau, which are laughable and devoid of the minimum foundation. The joke ran a swimming, and little by little it was embedded in the collective imagination, to the point that some less informed people take it for a supposed “discovery” recent. However, nonsense was released in 1907, and soon dismantled in 1911 by Jordan de Freitas. Judge Eduardo Ribeiro put more “points in the iis” in this regard. In your time I will publish the full documentation about the presence of Camões in Macao, putting a definitive end to the mythical “myth”. What life did Camões in Macau? We can say that these two years were those of the greatest professional, economic and affective in his life. Is it written poetry? Constantly, as the dimension of the work attests. A significant part of “the Lusíadas” was composed here, although the poem had neither began nor ended in Macao. Not least in his life was that it was in Macao who publicly assumed a relationship with a young Chinese, most exactly the Tanka ethnicity of poor fishermen. This asymmetrical connection is not surprising and with a modest young woman: only disadvantaged families would not prevent daughters from relate to foreigners. This explains the fact that she left with Camões in 1565 to Goa, with concubine status. But the private vessel in which they followed, belonging to Chinese merchants, suffered a wreck by Cambodia, and Camões lost there the “kind lamp I loved so much”. It was only after his death that he would come to chrisma as Denamene, a Greek nymph of the waters, so that she could live forever in the ocean. The Chinese of Macao have a special relationship with Camões, such as the Portuguese and the Macanese. How is this relationship? It existed in the eighteenth century in Macao the first monument in honor of Camões, something that in Portugal only began to think about the following century. Recebeu mesmo uma inscrição em chinês, e até um pavilhão chinês foi construído sobre o santuário dele. The Viscount of Juromenha says that in 1845 the Viceroy of Canton and Imperial Commissioner Ki-A there was worshiped Camões as the “Portuguese Confucius”. And rightly, Camões shares many aspects of the sages of Chinese tradition: he established a dialogue with the masters through the recreation of larger works, cultivated a millennial tradition (he gloss two thousand years prior to his own time), practiced itinerary as a source of "sagesse", said the primacy of poetry, conceived the rivers as mythical entities, even personifying them, even personifying them, even demonstrou acentuada tendência para moralizar, e epitomou o seu pensamento em sentenças magistrais. What connection did Camões have with Goa? Unlike Macao, Goa raised in Camões mostly negative feelings. The first impressions he had, like a lawless land in which only the little turns were worse, could not have been worse, as read in the initial letter to which he alluded: "long land, from all the poor honorable grave." In the second letter, he goes on, "I can say that it is the mother of bad villains, and stepmother of honorable men." These impressions would not improve over time, as corroborated the satire that led to the expulsion to Ternate in 1556. Goa, where he became the deputy protected, to fall later in the greatest disfavor under D. Antão de Noronha, was in his texts the inverted mirror of the Kingdom, the corrupt and corrupt Babylon, theil of God, and the betrayal of God, King and the law. In what is not original, as there are other sources that reinforce this Jeremiac and apocalyptic portrait of the capital of the Portuguese East Empire. Do you think Portugal should pay more attention to your writings, streamlining your work more? How? In Lisbon it is necessary to build a great literary museum dedicated to Camões and its creations.
